English: The Revelation of Jesus Christ, which God gave Him to show His servants—things which must shortly take place. And He sent and signified it by His angel to His servant John
Bahnar: Tơdrong âu, tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ Yêsu Krist tơ'bôh kơ lu đĭch đam Sư, tơdrong mă tĕnh truh mă gô 'bôh tơpă. Sư wơh linh jang 'lơ̆ng Sư năm tơ'bôh kơ Yôhan bơngai mă đĭch đam Sư.

English: who bore witness to the word of God, and to the testimony of Jesus Christ, to all things that he saw.
Bahnar: Na Yôhan chih roi tơpă dôm tơdrong mă đêl sư 'bôh noh; 'nâu boih tơdrong mă 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ Yêsu Krist tơ'bôh kơ sư.

English: Blessed is he who reads and those who hear the words of this prophecy, and keep those things which are written in it; for the time is near.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu đŏk ăn kơ đe tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei âu, bơngai noh sư hiôk boih. Bơngai mă mơ̆ng păng răk dôm nơ̆r pơma lăm hla bơar âu sư kư̆m hiôk mơ̆n, yua kơ ưh pă đunh boih 'Bok Kei-Dei wă tơ'bôh kơ kon bơngai dôm tơdrong Sư mă khan lê̆ adrol âu.

English: John, to the seven churches which are in Asia: Grace to you and peace from Him who is and who was and who is to come, and from the seven Spirits who are before His throne
Bahnar: Inh Yôhan chih kơthơ tơ'bôh kơ tơpơh tŏ hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ dêh char Asi. Inh apinh Sư âu: 'Bok Kei-Dei mă bơ̆n ư-ang, Sư đei đơ̆ng sơ̆ khơ̆ dang ei mă gô jur ning-mônh; Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng, Sư minh 'nu đĕch, mă-lei Sư dang tơpơh 'nu, Sư dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp 'Bok Kei-Dei

English: and from Jesus Christ, the faithful witness, the firstborn from the dead, and the ruler over the kings of the earth. To Him who loved us and washed us from our sins in His own blood
Bahnar: Yêsu Krist, Sư pơma tơpăt ling-lang, Sư iung arih đơ̆ng lôch adrol kơ đe, Sư pơgơ̆r đĭ-đăng lu 'bok pơtao oei tơ teh âu; na inh apinh Sư wei-lăng iĕm lăm tôm tơdrong wă kơ iĕm hiôk-hian ling-lang. Yêsu Krist 'mêm kơ bơ̆n tơpă na Sư pơklaih bơ̆n đơ̆ng tơdrong yoch hăm pham Sư.

English: and has made us kings and priests to His God and Father, to Him be glory and dominion forever and ever. Amen.
Bahnar: Sư pơjao bơ̆n kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei wă wei-lăng bơ̆n păng pơgơ̆r bơ̆n, na lu bơ̆n jing bơngai jang kơ 'Bă Sư 'Bok Kei-Dei thoi lu 'bok soi. Thoi noh na bĕ bơ̆n ư-ang Yêsu Krist yua kơ Sư gô pơgơ̆r ling-lang ưh kơ đei layơ tôch. A-men.

English: Behold, He is coming with clouds, and every eye will see Him, even they who pierced Him. And all the tribes of the earth will mourn because of Him. Even so, Amen.
Bahnar: Ning-mônh Sư wă jur tơ bơ̆n hăm hơmơ̆l. Đĭ-đăng kon bơngai gô 'bôh Sư. Lu bơngai mă pơ̆ng pơlôch Sư tơ 'long pơglang sơ̆ kư̆m 'bôh Sư mơ̆n. 'Bơ̆t noh kơnh đĭ-đăng khŭl kon bơngai jơ̆p kơ teh đak nhơ̆m hmoi 'bơ̆t anăp Sư; tơpă, trŏ kơ nhơ̆m hmoi tơpă mơ̆n. A-men.

English: “I am the Alpha and the Omega, the Beginning and the End,” says the Lord, “who is and who was and who is to come, the Almighty.”
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei Kră Yang tih hloh kơ đĭ-đăng păng pơgơ̆r tôm tĕch tơdrong, Sư đei đơ̆ng sơ̆ khơ̆ dang ei, mă gô jur ning-mônh, Sư khan thoi âu: “Inh thoi chư A, jĭ blŭng-a kơla chă hơdrol kơ đĭ-đăng lăm dôm tơdrong. Păng Inh kư̆m thoi chư Y, tuch-luch năr tôch kư̆m oei đei Inh.”

English: I, John, both your brother and companion in the tribulation and kingdom and patience of Jesus Christ, was on the island that is called Patmos for the word of God and for the testimony of Jesus Christ.
Bahnar: Mă gah inh âu, anăn inh Yôhan 'nhŏng oh iĕm. Đĭ-đăng kơ bơ̆n pôm đon hăm Yêsu Krist, đĭ-đăng kơ bơ̆n mă iĕm mă inh tă ngăl đei tơdrong gleh truh, đĭ-đăng kơ bơ̆n đei minh 'nu Yêsu Krist pơgơ̆r wei-lăng. Bơ̆n adrin lui kơjăp mă khan đe areh kơ bơ̆n, thoi lĕ kơ inh đe phak oei tơ bŏl đak mă đe anăn bŏl đak Patmôs, yua kơ inh ră roi kơ đe nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei păng tơdrong Yêsu.

English: I was in the Spirit on the Lord’s Day, and I heard behind me a loud voice, as of a trumpet
Bahnar: Đei minh năr, mă năr giĕng kơkuh kơ Kră Yang, na Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng tơ'bôh kơ inh tơdrong hlĭch. Inh kơtơ̆ng tơ rŏng inh nhen đei nơ̆r pơma re jơwa thoi đe hlôm keng

English: saying, “I am the Alpha and the Omega, the First and the Last,” and, “What you see, write in a book and send it to the seven churches which are in Asia: to Ephesus, to Smyrna, to Pergamos, to Thyatira, to Sardis, to Philadelphia, and to Laodicea.”
Bahnar: khan kơ inh thoi âu: “Dôm tơdrong ih wă pơtơm 'bôh dang ei, ih chih răk tơ hla bơar. Hla bơar noh ih pơtruh kơ tơpơh tŏ hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei: Hnam akŭm Pơlei Êphêsô, hnam akŭm Pơlei Samina, hnam akŭm Pơlei Pêgam, hnam akŭm Pơlei Thiatir, hnam akŭm Pơlei Sadis, hnam akŭm Pơlei Philadêphi păng hnam akŭm Pơlei Laodisê.”

English: Then I turned to see the voice that spoke with me. And having turned I saw seven golden lampstands
Bahnar: Na inh hue lăng tơ rŏng wă kơ băt bu pơma kơ inh noh hei. Lăp inh hue lăng inh 'bôh tơpơh tŏ jơ̆ng kơđeng maih.

English: and in the midst of the seven lampstands One like the Son of Man, clothed with a garment down to the feet and girded about the chest with a golden band.
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆t tŏk-bŏk jơ̆ng kơđeng noh inh 'bôh minh 'nu hơbŏ Sư thoi Kon Bơngai. Sư hrŭk ao tai păng chô̆ gơ'năm maih tơ kơtơh Sư.

English: His head and hair were white like wool, as white as snow, and His eyes like a flame of fire
Bahnar: Sŏk Sư kok hmông tôch tơdrong kok, măt Sư thoi pla ŭnh.

English: His feet were like fine brass, as if refined in a furnace, and His voice as the sound of many waters
Bahnar: Jơ̆ng Sư hơdah 'brŭng dreng thoi mam ngơr đe 'buh tơ ŭnh, 'bơ̆r Sư pơma mơ̆ng thoi jơwa đak chơkơi.

English: He had in His right hand seven stars, out of His mouth went a sharp two-edged sword, and His countenance was like the sun shining in its strength.
Bahnar: Tơpang ti Sư gah 'ma, Sư chĕp tơpơh tŏ sơnglŏng. Đei minh hlak đao han dêh, đao noh đei 'bar pah măt, lĕch đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r Sư pơma. Muh măt Sư rang hơdah dang măt 'năr pơchrang tŏk-bŏk 'năr dơ̆ng.

English: And when I saw Him, I fell at His feet as dead. But He laid His right hand on me, saying to me, “Do not be afraid; I am the First and the Last.
Bahnar: Kơplah noh lăp inh 'bôh Sư, inh pơ̆k hloi 'bơ̆t jơ̆ng Sư, inh hli tơrơ kơmăp lăl pă băt kơ akâu. Mă-lei ti 'ma Sư pel inh păng khan: “Ih 'nĕ kơ hli, Inh 'Bok tơm rơh hăm Inh ưh kơ đei layơ tôch.

English: I am He who lives, and was dead, and behold, I am alive forevermore. Amen. And I have the keys of Hades and of Death.
Bahnar: Inh arih ling-lang, Inh boih 'Bok mă lôch minh 'măng sơ̆, dang ei ưh pă layơ wă lôch dơ̆ng. Inh đei khuă gơh pơih 'măng lu bơngai lôch ăn kơ sư iung arih dơ̆ng.

English: Write the things which you have seen, and the things which are, and the things which will take place after this.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na dang ei Inh wă kơ ih chih dôm tơdrong mă ih 'bôh dang ei, dôm tơdrong chăl arih dang ei păng dôm tơdrong mă Inh gô tơ'bôh kơ chăl arih ning-mônh.

English: The mystery of the seven stars which you saw in My right hand, and the seven golden lampstands: The seven stars are the angels of the seven churches, and the seven lampstands which you saw are the seven churches.
Bahnar: Gah tơdrong tơpơh tŏ sơnglŏng mă ih 'bôh Inh chĕp tơ ti 'ma Inh 'noh hei păng tơpơh tŏ jơ̆ng kơđeng maih noh, na dang ei Inh wă roi tơblang ăn kơ ih. Tơpơh tŏ sơnglŏng noh wă khan tơpơh 'nu kră wei-lăng hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei. Tơpơh tŏ jơ̆ng kơđeng maih noh wă khan tơpơh tŏ hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei.”

English: “To the angel of the church of Ephesus write, ‘These things says He who holds the seven stars in His right hand, who walks in the midst of the seven golden lampstands
Bahnar: “Ih chih kơthơ âu kơ kră wei-lăng hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ Pơlei Êphêsô thoi âu: 'Bok mă chĕp tơpơh tŏ sơnglŏng tơ ti 'ma Sư, mă Sư nơnăm lăm tŏk-bŏk jơ̆ng kơđeng maih noh Sư wă pơma kơ iĕm thoi âu

English: “I know your works, your labor, your patience, and that you cannot bear those who are evil. And you have tested those who say they are apostles and are not, and have found them liars
Bahnar: ‘Inh băt mơ̆n tơdrong lui iĕm, Inh băt mơ̆n iĕm jang gleh, Inh băt mơ̆n đe areh kơ iĕm, iĕm oei lui kơjăp. Inh băt mơ̆n iĕm kuă kơ lu bơngai kơnê̆ oei hơdai iĕm. Lu sư hơlĕnh khan sư pơm jơ̆ng 'bang Inh mă-lei iĕm pơlong lăng lu sư boih, na iĕm băt boih kơ sư bơngai hơlĕnh.

English: and you have persevered and have patience, and have labored for My name’s sake and have not become weary.
Bahnar: Inh băt mơ̆n iĕm đei tơdrong gleh truh yua kơ jang tơdrong Inh, iĕm oei adrin khŏm khŏm ưh kơ lê̆.

English: Nevertheless I have this against you, that you have left your first love.
Bahnar: Mă-lei inh sơ'ngon kơ iĕm minh tơdrong âu: Iĕm ưh pă 'mêm kơ Inh hăm 'mêm kơ bôl buăl dang iĕm 'mêm tơm hmơm iĕm lui sơ̆.

English: Remember therefore from where you have fallen; repent and do the first works, or else I will come to you quickly and remove your lampstand from its place—unless you repent.
Bahnar: Na dang ei iĕm 'blŏk hơdơ̆r kơ tơdrong iĕm 'mêm sơ̆ dang yơ, iĕm athei 'mêm dang noh, 'nĕ kơ pơhơi. Tơ̆ng iĕm ưh kơ 'mêm dang tơm hmơm iĕm lui sơ̆, lei Inh wă năm hloi pơdrĕo iŏk jơ̆ng kơđeng maih đơ̆ng pơlei iĕm.

English: But this you have, that you hate the deeds of the Nicolaitans, which I also hate.
Bahnar: Mă-lei tơdrong âu Inh lăp đon kơ iĕm, Inh 'bôh iĕm ưh kơ lăp đon kơ đe bơtho tơdrong Nikôlat, Inh kư̆m ưh kơ lăp đon mơ̆n.

English: “He who has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches. To him who overcomes I will give to eat from the tree of life, which is in the midst of the Paradise of God.” ’
Bahnar: ‘Bơngai bu đei đon, mơ̆ng bĕ dôm tơdrong Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng pơma kơ rim hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei. Tơdrong tơblah păng yang kơnê̆ jei bu, Inh ăn kơ sư sa plei 'long kon bơngai arih. 'Long 'noh 'Bok Kei-Dei pơtăm tơ pơgar Sư tơ Pơlei 'Lơ̆ng Sư.’ ”

English: “And to the angel of the church in Smyrna write, ‘These things says the First and the Last, who was dead, and came to life
Bahnar: “Dang ei ih chih kơ kră wei-lăng hnam akŭm tơ Pơlei Samina thoi âu: 'Bok tơm rơh mă ưh kơ đei layơ tôch, mă lôch iung arih dơ̆ng, Sư wă pơma kơ iĕm thoi âu

English: “I know your works, tribulation, and poverty (but you are rich); and I know the blasphemy of those who say they are Jews and are not, but are a synagogue of Satan.
Bahnar: ‘Inh băt mơ̆n đe hil areh păng pơm kơnê̆ kơ iĕm. Inh băt mơ̆n iĕm bơngai dơnuh, mă-lei iĕm mơdrŏng tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei. Đei mơ'nah pơjăm pơjuă iĕm Inh kư̆m băt. Lu sư chă khan kơdih khan lu sư bơngai Juđê, mă tơpă ưh kơ bơngai Juđê ôh, lu sư hơlĕnh đĕch; lu sư khŭl yang Satan.

English: Do not fear any of those things which you are about to suffer. Indeed, the devil is about to throw some of you into prison, that you may be tested, and you will have tribulation ten days. Be faithful until death, and I will give you the crown of life.
Bahnar: Iĕm 'nĕ hli mă tơdrong wă truh kơ iĕm kơnh pơgê, yua kơ yang kơnê̆ wă tah lu iĕm mơ'nah tơ lăm hnam phak, wă pơlong lăng tơdrong lui iĕm. Iĕm oei tơ lăm hnam phak dang mơjĭt năr đe đei pơm kơ iĕm pơmat-tat dêh, mă-lei apinh iĕm adrin bĕ truh lôch, đơ̆ng noh na Inh gô tơ'băk kơ iĕm agăl pơkao tơdrong arih ling-lang.

English: “He who has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches. He who overcomes shall not be hurt by the second death.” ’
Bahnar: ‘Bơngai bu đei đon, mơ̆ng bĕ dôm tơdrong Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng pơma kơ rim hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei. Tơdrong tơblah păng yang kơnê̆ jei bu, Inh huay ăn kơ sư lôch mă 'bar.’ ”

English: “And to the angel of the church in Pergamos write, ‘These things says He who has the sharp two-edged sword
Bahnar: “Dang ei dơ̆ng ih chih kơ kră wei-lăng hnam akŭm tơ Pơlei Pêgam thoi âu: 'Bok mă đei minh hlak đao han đei 'bar pah măt noh Sư wă pơma kơ iĕm thoi âu

English: “I know your works, and where you dwell, where Satan’s throne is. And you hold fast to My name, and did not deny My faith even in the days in which Antipas was My faithful martyr, who was killed among you, where Satan dwells.
Bahnar: ‘Inh băt mơ̆n tơ pơlei iĕm noh đei yang Satan pơgơ̆r pơm pơtao. Mă-lei iĕm oei lui kơ Inh khŏm khŏm ưh kơ đei sơngah khan ưh kơ lui kơ Inh ôh. Na sơ̆ đe pơlôch buăl iĕm Antipa tơ pơlei iĕm, pơlei mă Satan pơgơ̆r. Antipa sư bơngai ră roi kơ đe tơdrong Inh tơpăt ling-lang ưh kơ layơ achăng lê̆ Inh. Na kơplah đe mă pơlôch sư sơ̆, iĕm kư̆m ưh kơ sơngah kơ Inh.

English: But I have a few things against you, because you have there those who hold the doctrine of Balaam, who taught Balak to put a stumbling block before the children of Israel, to eat things sacrificed to idols, and to commit sexual immorality.
Bahnar: Mă-lei Inh ưh kơ lăp đon kơ iĕm 'bar pêng tơdrong âu: Yua kơ đei lăm lu iĕm mơ'nah kiơ̆ tơdrong 'bok 'Balam. 'Bok 'Balam sơ̆ sư pơchŭt 'bok 'Balăk pơhlŭ lu bơngai Isơrael sa tơmam đe soi sơmah kơ rup yang păng wă kơ lu sư pơm pơyô kư̆ kă.

English: Thus you also have those who hold the doctrine of the Nicolaitans, which thing I hate.
Bahnar: Na đei lăm lu iĕm mơ'nah kư̆m thoi noh mơ̆n, iĕm lui kơ đe bơtho tơdrong Nikôlat.

English: Repent, or else I will come to you quickly and will fight against them with the sword of My mouth.
Bahnar: Na dang ei iĕm athei tơbral kơdih tơdrong yoch. Tơ̆ng iĕm ưh kơ tơbral, lei Inh ưh kơ anat ôh, Inh năm blah hloi dôm lu iĕm mă lui kơ tơdrong Nikôlat noh. Inh blah păng đao mă lĕch đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r Inh noh.’

English: “He who has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches. To him who overcomes I will give some of the hidden manna to eat. And I will give him a white stone, and on the stone a new name written which no one knows except him who receives it.” ’
Bahnar: ‘Bơngai bu đei đon, mơ̆ng bĕ dôm tơdrong Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng pơma kơ rim hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei. Tơdrong tơblah păng yang kơnê̆ jei bu, Inh gô ăn kơ bơngai noh 'bĕng mana mă kon bơngai tơ ala teh ưh tam đei sa ôh păng Inh gô pôk anăn sư 'nao, anăn 'nao noh Inh chih tơ tơmo kok lat, na ăn kơ sư. Anăn noh lu đe nai ưh kơ băt ôh, pôm sư kơdih đĕch băt.’ ”

English: “And to the angel of the church in Thyatira write, ‘These things says the Son of God, who has eyes like a flame of fire, and His feet like fine brass
Bahnar: “Dang ei dơ̆ng Inh wă kơ ih chih kơthơ kơ kră hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ Pơlei Thiatir thoi âu: Âu boih Kon 'Bok Kei-Dei, 'Bok mă măt Sư thoi pla ŭnh, jơ̆ng Sư hơdah 'brŭng dreng thoi mam ngơr đe 'buh tơ ŭnh, na Sư wă pơma kơ iĕm thoi âu

English: “I know your works, love, service, faith, and your patience; and as for your works, the last are more than the first.
Bahnar: ‘Inh băt tơdrong lui iĕm, iĕm 'mêm kơ Inh hăm 'mêm kơ bôl buăl, iĕm lui kơjăp, iĕm jang tơdrong Inh ling-lang, iĕm đei tơdrong gleh truh iĕm oei adrin khŏm khŏm, tơdrong lui iĕm tŏk rai đunh rai kơjăp mơ̆n.

English: Nevertheless I have a few things against you, because you allow that woman Jezebel, who calls herself a prophetess, to teach and seduce My servants to commit sexual immorality and eat things sacrificed to idols.
Bahnar: Mă-lei minh tơdrong âu Inh ưh kơ lăp đon kơ iĕm, minh tơdrong iĕm kuă kơ pơpuh yă Jesebel bơngai kơnê̆ dêh. Sư khan sư bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei, mă-lei sư oei pơhlŭ lu đĭch đam Inh pơm pơyô ngôi kư̆ kă, sa tơmam đe soi sơmah kơ rup yang.

English: And I gave her time to repent of her sexual immorality, and she did not repent.
Bahnar: Inh khan kơ sư boih, athei tơbral kơdih tơdrong yoch, mă-lei sư ưh kơ chu tơbral.

English: Indeed I will cast her into a sickbed, and those who commit adultery with her into great tribulation, unless they repent of their deeds.
Bahnar: Na dang ei Inh gô pơm kơ sư jĭ dêh 'bĭch păn tơ giơng. Na lu bơngai mă lui kiơ̆ kơ sư pơm kư̆ kă, dah ưh kơ chu tơbral kơdih tơdrong yoch, Inh kư̆m pơm kơ lu sư đei tơdrong gleh pơmat-tat mơ̆n.

English: I will kill her children with death, and all the churches shall know that I am He who searches the minds and hearts. And I will give to each one of you according to your works.
Bahnar: Păng lu bơngai mă pơm jơ̆ng 'bang sư mă lăng dang kon sư kơdih noh, Inh kư̆m pơlôch mơ̆n. Tơdrong noh wă tơbăt kơ đĭ-đăng lu bơngai lui wă lu bơngai lui băt kơ Inh sek tơlang lăm jơhngơ̆m đon lu sư tơpăt noh na inh gô apah lu sư kiơ̆ thoi lu sư đêl pơm.

English: “Now to you I say, and to the rest in Thyatira, as many as do not have this doctrine, who have not known the depths of Satan, as they say, I will put on you no other burden.
Bahnar: ‘Iĕm bơngai Pơlei Thiatir păng lu bôl iĕm mơ'nah kuă kơ kiơ̆ tơdrong yă Jesebel tơpă. Sư khan tơdrong sư bơtho tơdrong jrŭ, tơdrong hơgei, mă-lei iĕm kuă kơ pơhrăm iŏk hơya tŏ sĕt tơdrong noh yua kơ iĕm băt tơdrong noh tơdrong yang Satan đĕch. Bĭ mă Inh kư̆m ưh kơ đei pơthim kơ iĕm kiơ̆ tơdrong kiơ mă anat ôh.

English: But hold fast what you have till I come.
Bahnar: Inh wă kơ iĕm kư̆ kơ lui kơjăp khŏm khŏm truh tơ năr Inh jur ning-mônh.

English: And he who overcomes, and keeps My works until the end, to him I will give power over the nations
Bahnar: ‘Tơdrong tơblah păng yang kơnê̆ wă kơ jei, sư athei adrin ling-lang khŏm khŏm dĭng truh tơ năr Inh jur ning-mônh, Inh gô pôk sư pơm 'bok pơgơ̆r lu teh đak đe, thoi 'Bă Inh ăn kơ Inh kư̆m pơgơ̆r thoi noh.

English: ‘He shall rule them with a rod of iron; They shall be dashed to pieces like the potter’s vessels’— as I also have received from My Father
Bahnar: Bơngai noh jing 'bok pơgơ̆r chĕp 'long jra mam, sư pơgơ̆r teh đak đe pran kơtang, teh đak đe gô pơchah răm thoi gŏ teh.

English: and I will give him the morning star.
Bahnar: Păng Inh gô ăn kơ sư sơnglŏng wŏng-tar.

English: “He who has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches.” ’
Bahnar: Bơngai bu đei đon, mơ̆ng bĕ dôm tơdrong Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng pơma kơ lu bơngai lui tơ rim hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei.’ ”

English: “And to the angel of the church in Sardis write, ‘These things says He who has the seven Spirits of God and the seven stars: “I know your works, that you have a name that you are alive, but you are dead.
Bahnar: “Na dang ei dơ̆ng ih chih kơthơ ăn kơ kră wei-lăng hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ Pơlei Sadis, ih chih kơ sư thoi âu: Âu boih 'Bok mă đei minh 'nu Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng mă dang tơpơh 'nu, mă Sư chĕp tơpơh tŏ sơnglŏng tơ tơpang ti Sư noh, na dang ei Sư wă pơma kơ iĕm thoi âu: ‘Inh băt mơ̆n dôm tơdrong lui iĕm thoi yơ. Đĭ-đăng bơngai ư-ang kơ iĕm khan iĕm bơngai lui kơjăp; mă tơpă iĕm rơdu dêh dang bơngai wă kơtĕch jơhngơ̆m wă lôch.

English: Be watchful, and strengthen the things which remain, that are ready to die, for I have not found your works perfect before God.
Bahnar: Na dang ei iĕm adrin pơjăng 'biơ̆ bĕ, yua kơ iĕm rơdu tơpă dang bơngai jê̆ kơtĕch jơhngơ̆m wă lôch. Iĕm athei hơmet ming tơdrong lui iĕm mă kơjăp dơ̆ng, yua kơ Inh băt 'Bok Kei-Dei lăng dôm tơdrong iĕm pơm ưh kơ 'blep ngăl.

English: Remember therefore how you have received and heard; hold fast and repent. Therefore if you will not watch, I will come upon you as a thief, and you will not know what hour I will come upon you.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na iĕm athei 'blŏk hơdơ̆r kơ dôm tơdrong iĕm kơtơ̆ng đe bơtho iĕm sơ̆ thoi yơ, iĕm athei pơm kiơ̆ thoi noh păng tơbral kơdih dôm tơdrong yoch mă iĕm juăt kơ pơm. Dah iĕm ưh kơ adrin pơjăng 'biơ̆, lei Inh gô năm tơ iĕm thoi bơngai tơtông kơmăng, pơm kơ iĕm đei tơdrong gleh truh kơplah iĕm ưh kơ lêng ê.

English: You have a few names even in Sardis who have not defiled their garments; and they shall walk with Me in white, for they are worthy.
Bahnar: Lăm pơlei iĕm kư̆m oei đei mơ̆n bơngai lui kơjăp mă ưh kơ lơ. Ao lu sư ưh kơ mơgrĭ thoi ao lu bơngai nai ôh. Ning-mônh lu sư gô hrŭk ao kok nơnăm hơdai păng Inh, yua kơ lu sư lui kơjăp.

English: He who overcomes shall be clothed in white garments, and I will not blot out his name from the Book of Life; but I will confess his name before My Father and before His angels.
Bahnar: ‘Tơdrong tơblah păng yang kơnê̆ jei bu, Inh gô ăn kơ sư hrŭk ao kok thoi noh mơ̆n. Inh ưh kơ sut lê̆ anăn sư tơ hla bơar mă đêl Inh chih wă ăn kơ sư arih ôh. Inh rai roi kơ 'Bă Inh păng roi kơ lu linh jang 'lơ̆ng tơdrong sư lui kơ Inh kơjăp.

English: “He who has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches.” ’
Bahnar: Bơngai bu đei đon, mơ̆ng bĕ dôm tơdrong Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng pơma kơ lu bơngai lui tơ rim hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei.’ ”

English: “And to the angel of the church in Philadelphia write, ‘These things says He who is holy, He who is true, “He who has the key of David, He who opens and no one shuts, and shuts and no one opens”
Bahnar: “Dang ei ih chih kơthơ pơtruh kơ kră wei-lăng hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ Pơlei Philadêphi thoi âu: “Âu boih 'Bok mă 'lơ̆ng tơpăt, Sư chĕp khuă 'bok pơtao Đawit, Sư gơh pơih 'măng ăn kơ iĕm mơ̆t, ưh kơ đei bu gơh tang chơkăl dơ̆ng, Sư tang 'măng ưh kơ đei bu gơh pơih dơ̆ng, na dang ei Sư wă pơma kơ iĕm thoi âu

English: “I know your works. See, I have set before you an open door, and no one can shut it; for you have a little strength, have kept My word, and have not denied My name.
Bahnar: ‘Inh băt mơ̆n tơdrong lui iĕm thoi yơ. Bơngai lui tơ pơlei iĕm ưh kơ gan lơ ră, mă-lei iĕm oei kiơ̆ dôm nơ̆r Inh pơkă kơ iĕm. Păng iĕm ưh kơ đei sơngah khan ưh kơ lui kơ Inh ôh. Na dang ei Inh pơih ăn kơ iĕm 'măng mơ̆t lĕch boih, ưh kơ đei bu gơh tang chơkăl kuă ăn iĕm mơ̆t lĕch.

English: Indeed I will make those of the synagogue of Satan, who say they are Jews and are not, but lie—indeed I will make them come and worship before your feet, and to know that I have loved you.
Bahnar: Lu đe mơ'nah khan lu sư bơngai Juđê, mă tơpă lu sư ưh kơ trŏ bơngai Juđê ôh, lu sư hơlĕnh đĕch; tơdrong lu sư chă akŭm, lu sư akŭm tơdrong yang Satan. Thoi noh na Inh gô ăn kơ lu sư sơtơ̆p kŭl-tăng 'bơ̆t anăp iĕm, na Inh gô bơtho lu sư tơdrong Inh 'mêm kơ iĕm.

English: Because you have kept My command to persevere, I also will keep you from the hour of trial which shall come upon the whole world, to test those who dwell on the earth.
Bahnar: Inh 'bôh iĕm đei tơdrong gleh pơmat-tat, mă-lei iĕm kư̆m oei adrin kiơ̆ thoi Inh sơ̆. Yua kơ thoi noh na Inh 'mêm kơ iĕm, wei-lăng iĕm kơplah 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn tơdrong gleh truh kơ rim 'nu bơngai jơ̆p kơ teh đak wă pơlong lăng kon bơngai thoi yơ.

English: Behold, I am coming quickly! Hold fast what you have, that no one may take your crown.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ đunh ôh Inh wă jur dơ̆ng. Dang ei iĕm lui kơjăp boih, iĕm 'nĕ kơ achăng lê̆ dôm tơdrong Inh, wă kơ Inh huay kơ iŏk agăl pơkao iĕm, ăn kơ bơngai nai.

English: He who overcomes, I will make him a pillar in the temple of My God, and he shall go out no more. I will write on him the name of My God and the name of the city of My God, the New Jerusalem, which comes down out of heaven from My God. And I will write on him My new name.
Bahnar: ‘Tơdrong tơblah păng yang kơnê̆ jei bơngai bu, Inh gô ăn kơ bơngai noh pơm jrăng hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei 'Bă Inh tơ Pơlei 'Lơ̆ng Sư. Sư pơdơ̆ng wei hnam noh ling-lang. Păng Inh chơ̆m đŏng yâu 'Bok Kei-Dei 'Bă Inh tơ klĕng sư păng anăn Pơlei 'Lơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei 'Bă Inh. Pơlei 'noh wă khan Pơlei Jêrusalem 'nao mă 'Bă Inh gô tơjur đơ̆ng plĕnh ning-mônh. Păng Inh kư̆m chơ̆m đŏng yâu Inh tơ klĕng sư. Đŏng yâu noh chih anăn Inh 'nao pơjing.

English: “He who has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches.” ’
Bahnar: Bơngai bu đei đon, mơ̆ng bĕ dôm tơdrong Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng pơma kơ lu bơngai lui tơ rim hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei.’ ”

English: “And to the angel of the church of the Laodiceans write, ‘These things says the Amen, the Faithful and True Witness, the Beginning of the creation of God
Bahnar: “Dang ei ih chih kơthơ pơtruh kơ kră wei-lăng hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ Pơlei Laodisê thoi âu: “Âu boih 'Bok mă 'lơ̆ng tơpăt ling-lang, Sư pơma tơpăt ngăl tơpă. Sư boih mă 'Bok Kei-Dei yua đơ̆ng sơ̆ wă pơjing tôm tơdrong, Sư wă pơma kơ iĕm tơdrong âu

English: “I know your works, that you are neither cold nor hot. I could wish you were cold or hot.
Bahnar: ‘Inh băt tôm tơdrong iĕm. Tơdrong sơngah kuă kơ lui kơ Inh iĕm kư̆m ưh, tơdrong adrin iĕm kư̆m ưh kơ adrin mơ̆n, lăp mơlôh mơlônh; wă jing đak sơngiĕo kư̆m ưh, wă jing đak tŏ kư̆m ưh mơ̆n, lăp mơlôh mơlônh. Inh wă kơ iĕm thoi âu: Tơ̆ng iĕm wă kơ jing đak tŏ, iĕm athei jing thoi đak tŏ mă tơpă. Tơ̆ng wă jing thoi đak sơngiĕo, iĕm athei jing thoi đak sơngiĕo.

English: So then, because you are lukewarm, and neither cold nor hot, I will vomit you out of My mouth.
Bahnar: Yua kơ iĕm thoi đak tŏ lăp ŏ-ŏr na Inh gô kơ'môch tŭk đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r Inh.

English: Because you say, ‘I am rich, have become wealthy, and have need of nothing’—and do not know that you are wretched, miserable, poor, blind, and naked
Bahnar: Păng iĕm pơang kơ đe khan iĕm mơdrŏng kơ nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei boih, huay pă kăl kơ tơdrong kiơ dơ̆ng. Iĕm ưh kơ băt kơdih, iĕm bơngai pơmat-tat, bơngai răm-'băm, bơngai dơnuh hin, bơngai măt tol, ưh kơ mah hơbĕn ao hrŭk.

English: I counsel you to buy from Me gold refined in the fire, that you may be rich; and white garments, that you may be clothed, that the shame of your nakedness may not be revealed; and anoint your eyes with eye salve, that you may see.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na Inh wă kơ iĕm răt iŏk maih mă đêl Inh pơlong 'buh tơ ŭnh boih, wă kơ iĕm mơdrŏng păng răt iŏk hơbĕn ao kok đơ̆ng Inh, hrŭk bĕ, wă huay mơlâu kơ đe yua kơ iĕm akâu hoh; răt pơgang jĭ măt pik wă kơ klaih gơh 'bôh hơdah.

English: As many as I love, I rebuke and chasten. Therefore be zealous and repent.
Bahnar: ‘Dôm lu bơngai mă Inh 'mêm, Inh bơtho khan kơ lu sư hăm tơdrong gleh truh, pơm kơ lu sư dang Inh tôn dang Inh teh wă kơ lu sư jah tơbral na jing chu. Na dang ei iĕm athei tơbral kơdih tơdrong yoch păng adrin jang tơdrong Inh mă tơpă.

English: Behold, I stand at the door and knock. If anyone hears My voice and opens the door, I will come in to him and dine with him, and he with Me.
Bahnar: Dang ei Inh oei dơ̆ng tơ 'ngoaih 'măng wă krao iĕm. Bu kơtơ̆ng 'bơ̆r Inh krao na pơih kơ Inh 'măng, bơngai noh Inh wă mơ̆t oei hăm sư, sŏng sa hơdai sư.

English: To him who overcomes I will grant to sit with Me on My throne, as I also overcame and sat down with My Father on His throne.
Bahnar: ‘Gah tơdrong tơblah păng yang kơnê̆ jei bơngai bu, Inh gô ăn kơ sư oei hơdai tơ tang-dŏ Inh, thoi Inh blah yang kơnê̆ jei Inh, na 'Bă Inh ăn kơ Inh oei hơdai tơ tang-dŏ Sư.

English: “He who has an ear, let him hear what the Spirit says to the churches.” ’ ”
Bahnar: Bơngai bu đei đon, mơ̆ng bĕ dôm tơdrong Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng pơma kơ lu bơngai lui tơ rim hnam akŭm 'Bok Kei-Dei.’ ”

English: After these things I looked, and behold, a door standing open in heaven. And the first voice which I heard was like a trumpet speaking with me, saying, “Come up here, and I will show you things which must take place after this.”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh inh ngơk lăng tơ plĕnh, inh 'bôh plĕnh tơpơih thoi 'măng. Păng inh kơtơ̆ng dơ̆ng 'bơ̆r 'Bok mă pơma re jơwa dang đe hlôm keng noh hei, Sư pơma dơ̆ng kơ inh dang ei khan: “Apinh ih tŏk tơ âu, Inh wă tơ'bôh kơ ih dôm tơdrong mă gô đei păng gô 'bôh ning-mônh.”

English: Immediately I was in the Spirit; and behold, a throne set in heaven, and One sat on the throne.
Bahnar: Na Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng pơm kơ inh ưh kơ băt thoi yơ, 'bôh 'băi tơ kơpal plĕnh boih. Na inh 'bôh tang-dŏ 'lơ̆ng rŏ tơ plĕnh ei, tang-dŏ ei đei minh 'nu oei.

English: And He who sat there was like a jasper and a sardius stone in appearance; and there was a rainbow around the throne, in appearance like an emerald.
Bahnar: 'Bok mă oei tơ tang-dŏ ei inh lăng Sư dang tơmo rang mơnhal, tăp dăr kơ tang-dŏ Sư oei ei đei hơdah jơk thoi plĕnh chro.

English: Around the throne were twenty-four thrones, and on the thrones I saw twenty-four elders sitting, clothed in white robes; and they had crowns of gold on their heads.
Bahnar: Tăp dăr kơ tang-dŏ 'Bok Pơtao ei đei 'bar-jĭt puăn tŏ tang-dŏ nai, đei 'bar-jĭt puăn 'nu lu đe kră oei tơ tang-dŏ ei. Lu sư tă hrŭk ao tai kok păng yơ̆l môk maih.

English: And from the throne proceeded lightnings, thunderings, and voices. Seven lamps of fire were burning before the throne, which are the seven Spirits of God.
Bahnar: Păng 'bôh kơchêr kơchar kơmlat lĕch đơ̆ng tang-dŏ 'Bok Pơtao mă oei tŏk-bŏk. Păng inh kơtơ̆ng grơ̆m glaih tơdrăng. 'Bơ̆t anăp tang-dŏ 'Bok Pơtao ei, đei tơpơh tŏ ŭnh kơđeng sư khơ̆ng ling-lang. Kơđeng ei wă pơtih gia kơ Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng Sư. Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng minh 'nu đĕch, mă-lei dang tơpơh 'nu.

English: Before the throne there was a sea of glass, like crystal. And in the midst of the throne, and around the throne, were four living creatures full of eyes in front and in back.
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆t anăp tang-dŏ 'Bok Pơtao ei kư̆m đei đak, mă thoi đak dơsĭ hlăng chơchơr thoi getchai thoi amĭl. Tăp dăr kơ tang-dŏ 'Bok Pơtao ei, đei puăn anăn lu sem brem. Lu sư đei klong măt rŏng anăp lơlap.

English: The first living creature was like a lion, the second living creature like a calf, the third living creature had a face like a man, and the fourth living creature was like a flying eagle.
Bahnar: Sem mă mônh hơbŏ sư thoi dăm-brang, sem mă 'bar hơbŏ sư thoi rơmo, mă pêng muh măt sư thoi bơngai, sem mă puăn hơbŏ sư thoi sem klang păr kơpal plĕnh.

English: The four living creatures, each having six wings, were full of eyes around and within. And they do not rest day or night, saying: “Holy, holy, holy, Lord God Almighty, Who was and is and is to come!”
Bahnar: Rim kơ puăn anăn noh đei tơdrâu hlak pơnăr păng đei klong măt rŏng anăp jơ̆p-jang kơ akâu. Lu sư hơri ư-ang 'Bok Kei-Dei măng năr pă pơdơh 'bơ̆r. Tơdrong lu sư hơri ei thoi âu: “Ô 'lơ̆ng tơpă, ô kăl tơpă 'Bok Kei-Dei Kră Yang Tih Hloh. Pôm Ih đĕch 'lơ̆ng tơpăt. Ih đei đơ̆ng sơ̆ khơ̆ dang ei păng Ih gô jur ning-mônh.”

English: Whenever the living creatures give glory and honor and thanks to Him who sits on the throne, who lives forever and ever
Bahnar: Rim wơ̆t lu sem brem ei hơri ư-ang 'Bok Pơtao mă oei tơ tang-dŏ, 'Bok mă arih ling-lang ưh kơ layơ tôch

English: the twenty-four elders fall down before Him who sits on the throne and worship Him who lives forever and ever, and cast their crowns before the throne, saying
Bahnar: na đĭ-đăng 'bar-jĭt puăn 'nu lu đe kră ei 'nap kơkuh kơ 'Bok Pơtao mă oei tơ tang-dŏ, 'Bok mă arih ling-lang ưh kơ layơ tôch ei. Môk maih lu sư 'măn 'bơ̆t anăp tang-dŏ 'Bok Pơtao, na lu sư hơri thoi âu

English: “You are worthy, O Lord, To receive glory and honor and power; For You created all things, And by Your will they exist and were created.”
Bahnar: “Ơ 'Bok Kei-Dei Kră Yang, pôm Ih đĕch mơsêh na trŏ kơ nhôn lui yom păng ư-ang kơ Ih tơpă, yua kơ Ih gơh pơjing kơdih lăm tôm tơdrong. Mă tôm tơdrong kiơ yua kơ Ih wă na Ih pơjing hloi.”

English: And I saw in the right hand of Him who sat on the throne a scroll written inside and on the back, sealed with seven seals.
Bahnar: Păng inh 'bôh 'Bok Kei-Dei oei tơ tang-dŏ Sư, ti Sư gah 'ma chĕp minh sơnôm hla bơar, hla bơar ei chih 'bar pah rŏng klak na lôm pơklep sư tơpơh 'măng pơklep, wă kơ băt tơdra hli kơ đe hek lăng.

English: Then I saw a strong angel proclaiming with a loud voice, “Who is worthy to open the scroll and to loose its seals?”
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh inh 'bôh minh 'nu linh jang 'lơ̆ng sư pran tih, sư pơma 'bơ̆r re khan: “Hăm đei bu hơnhŏ wă hek lăng hla bơar mă đêl đe pơklep boih noh?”

English: And no one in heaven or on the earth or under the earth was able to open the scroll, or to look at it.
Bahnar: Ưh kơ đei bu hơnhŏ wă hek lăng ôh, mă lu oei tơ plĕnh, mă lu oei tơ teh, mă lu lôch oei trôm teh kư̆m ưh kơ đei bu hơnhŏ wă hek lăng hla bơar noh.

English: So I wept much, because no one was found worthy to open and read the scroll, or to look at it.
Bahnar: Inh băt kơ thoi noh boih na inh nhơ̆m hmoi ơh kơdih, yua kơ ưh kơ đei bu hơnhŏ wă hek lăng hla bơar noh lăm to sư thoi yơ.

English: But one of the elders said to me, “Do not weep. Behold, the Lion of the tribe of Judah, the Root of David, has prevailed to open the scroll and to loose its seven seals.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei đei minh 'nu lăm lu đe kră noh khan kơ inh thoi âu: “Ih 'nĕ pă nhơ̆m, to gô dăm-brang adrĕch adrung Juđa păng Đawit hek lăng hla bơar noh. Pôm Sư đĕch trŏ kơ hek lăng hla bơar noh, yua kơ Sư tơblah păng yang kơnê̆ jei Sư boih.”

English: And I looked, and behold, in the midst of the throne and of the four living creatures, and in the midst of the elders, stood a Lamb as though it had been slain, having seven horns and seven eyes, which are the seven Spirits of God sent out into all the earth.
Bahnar: Inh kơtơ̆ng sư pơma thoi noh na inh chă lăng 'bôh minh pôm Kon Triu oei jê̆ tang-dŏ 'Bok Pơtao, tŏk-bŏk puăn anăn lu sem brem noh păng tŏk-bŏk 'bar-jĭt puăn 'nu lu đe kră. Na Kon Triu ei Sư iung dang dơ̆ng, inh 'bôh rơka Sư đêl đe 'bet pơlôch sơ̆. Kon Triu ei đei tơpơh tŏ ake, tơpơh tŏ măt, 'noh wă kơ đe băt kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng Sư nơnăm jơ̆p-jang kơ teh đak.

English: Then He came and took the scroll out of the right hand of Him who sat on the throne.
Bahnar: Na Kon Triu ei Sư năm iŏk hla bơar đơ̆ng ti 'Bok Kei-Dei mă oei tơ tang-dŏ.

English: Now when He had taken the scroll, the four living creatures and the twenty-four elders fell down before the Lamb, each having a harp, and golden bowls full of incense, which are the prayers of the saints.
Bahnar: Lăp Kon Triu ei iŏk hla bơar noh boih, na puăn anăn lu sem brem noh păng 'bar-jĭt puăn 'nu lu đe kră, lu sư 'nap kơkuh kơ Kon Triu. Klaih kơ noh rim 'nu kơ lu sư chĕp brŏ reh păng chĕp pơnhan maih, lăm pơnhan ei 'bĕnh kơ đak pơgang 'bâu phu. Đak pơgang 'bâu phu ei wă pơtih gia kơ lu kon 'Bok Kei-Dei krao khan kơ Sư kơtơ̆ng truh tơ Sư tơpă.

English: And they sang a new song, saying: “You are worthy to take the scroll, And to open its seals; For You were slain, And have redeemed us to God by Your blood Out of every tribe and tongue and people and nation
Bahnar: Na lu đe ei hơri minh tơdrong 'nao thoi âu: “Pôm Ih đĕch trŏ kơ hek lăng hla bơar đe pơklep noh yua kơ Ih lôch tang kon bơngai, păng pham Ih lĕch sĕch Ih huŏng huai iŏk kon bơngai brŏk tơ 'Bok Kei-Dei đơ̆ng rim dêh char, rim adrĕch adrung, rim khŭl bơngai, rim kơ nơ̆r pơma.

English: And have made us kings and priests to our God; And we shall reign on the earth.”
Bahnar: Păng Ih ăn kơ kon bơngai jing pơlei pơla 'Bok Kei-Dei wei-lăng păng pơgơ̆r. Ih ăn kon bơngai pơm thoi 'bok soi wă kơ chă pơjing tơdrong jang 'Bok Kei-Dei, păng Ih ăn kơ kon bơngai gơh chă pơgơ̆r tơduă lu sư tơ ala teh.”

English: Then I looked, and I heard the voice of many angels around the throne, the living creatures, and the elders; and the number of them was ten thousand times ten thousand, and thousands of thousands
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh inh 'bôh dơ̆ng tăp dăr kơ tang-dŏ 'Bok Pơtao păng tăp dăr puăn anăn hăm 'bar-jĭt puăn 'nu lu đe kră ei, inh 'bôh lơlang lơlap ưh kơ băt dôm yơ rơbâu hơngan trĭu 'nu lu linh jang 'lơ̆ng.

English: saying with a loud voice: “Worthy is the Lamb who was slain To receive power and riches and wisdom, And strength and honor and glory and blessing!”
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng kơ lu sư hơri minh nơ̆r hơdai. Tơdrong lu sư hơri ei thoi âu: “Ih Kon Triu mă đe pơlôch, Ih mơsêh mơyang, Ih mơdrŏng tih hơgei tôm tơdrong păng pran tih hloh kơ đĭ-đăng, na trŏ kơ nhôn lui yom păng ư-ang Ih tơpă.”

English: And every creature which is in heaven and on the earth and under the earth and such as are in the sea, and all that are in them, I heard saying: “Blessing and honor and glory and power Be to Him who sits on the throne, And to the Lamb, forever and ever!”
Bahnar: Na inh kơtơ̆ng dơ̆ng pă minh khŭl tôm kơ đĭ-đăng anăn đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei pơjing plĕnh hăm teh sơ̆, tôm kơ anăn lu bơngai lôch, tôm kơ anăn kon sem lăm đak dơsĭ, đĭ lu sư hơri minh nơ̆r hơdai thoi âu: “Bơnê kơ 'Bok Pơtao mă oei tơ tang-dŏ, hăm bơnê kơ Kon Triu, mơsêh mơyang 'lơ̆ng rŏ trŏ kơ nhôn lui yom păng ư-ang ling-lang ưh kơ layơ tôch.”

English: Then the four living creatures said, “Amen!” And the twenty-four elders fell down and worshiped Him who lives forever and ever.
Bahnar: Na puăn anăn lu sem brem 'noh khan: “Trŏ boih iĕm khan thoi noh.” Na 'bar-jĭt puăn 'nu lu đe kră kư̆m wang 'nap kơkuh kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei hăm Kon Triu.

English: Now I saw when the Lamb opened one of the seals; and I heard one of the four living creatures saying with a voice like thunder, “Come and see.”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh na inh 'bôh Kon Triu hek hla bơar đêl đe pơklep tơdra noh. Sư hek tơdra mă mônh lăm tơpơh tŏ tơdra noh, inh kơtơ̆ng minh pôm lăm puăn anăn sem noh, sư krao minh 'nu bơngai hao aseh kok, sư pơma 'bơ̆r re dang grơ̆m glaih tơdrăng, sư khan thoi âu: “Tơ âu bĕ.”

English: And I looked, and behold, a white horse. He who sat on it had a bow; and a crown was given to him, and he went out conquering and to conquer.
Bahnar: Na bơngai hao aseh kok ei năm hloi tơ sư chĕp jŏ hră. Đe ăn kơ sư agăl pơkao wă pơtih gia kơ tơdrong sư blah đe jei sư. Na sư năm tơblah. Sư blah đe jei sư tơpă.

English: When He opened the second seal, I heard the second living creature saying, “Come and see.”
Bahnar: Kon Triu hek tơdra mă 'bar, inh kơtơ̆ng anăn sem mă 'bar krao bơngai hao aseh 'brê, sư khan: “Tơ âu bĕ.”

English: Another horse, fiery red, went out. And it was granted to the one who sat on it to take peace from the earth, and that people should kill one another; and there was given to him a great sword.
Bahnar: Na bơngai hao aseh 'brê ei năm tơ sư. 'Bok Kei-Dei pơjao ăn kơ bơngai ei pơgơ̆r tơdrong gleh pơmat-tat jơ̆p kơ teh đak, wă kơ kon bơngai pơlôch dih băl. Na đe ăn kơ bơngai hao aseh 'brê ei minh hlak đao tih.

English: When He opened the third seal, I heard the third living creature say, “Come and see.” So I looked, and behold, a black horse, and he who sat on it had a pair of scales in his hand.
Bahnar: Inh 'bôh Kon Triu hek dơ̆ng tơdra mă pêng. Na inh kơtơ̆ng anăn mă pêng khan thoi âu: “Tơ âu bĕ.” Na đei minh 'nu bơngai hao aseh găm chĕp kĭ năm tơ sư. Kĭ noh wă tơbăt ăn kơ kon bơngai gô đei tơdrong pơngot rơwĕt.

English: And I heard a voice in the midst of the four living creatures saying, “A quart of wheat for a denarius, and three quarts of barley for a denarius; and do not harm the oil and the wine.”
Bahnar: Păng inh kơtơ̆ng đơ̆ng lăm tŏk-bŏk lu puăn anăn noh đei 'bơ̆r pơma thoi âu: “Phe 'lơ̆ng đe gô tĕch minh kĭ minh năr jên jang, phe ưh kơ gan 'lơ̆ng đe gô tĕch pêng kĭ minh năr jên jang. Mă-lei gah lu đak rơmă, đak sik, sư ưh kơ tĕch kăp dang noh ôh.”

English: When He opened the fourth seal, I heard the voice of the fourth living creature saying, “Come and see.”
Bahnar: Kon Triu hek dơ̆ng tơdra mă puăn, inh kơtơ̆ng anăn sem mă puăn sư khan thoi âu: “Tơ âu bĕ.”

English: So I looked, and behold, a pale horse. And the name of him who sat on it was Death, and Hades followed with him. And power was given to them over a fourth of the earth, to kill with sword, with hunger, with death, and by the beasts of the earth.
Bahnar: Na inh 'bôh minh pôm aseh hiang hơlơp ưh kơ đei jơhngơ̆m. Bơngai mă hao aseh ei đe anăn sư yŏng pơgơ̆r gah tơdrong lôch. Đei minh 'nu nai kiơ̆ đơ̆ng rŏng sư, sư bơngai pơgơ̆r dêh atâu. Bre sư, 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn pơgơ̆r pơm yŏng đe năm tơblah chĕp khêl đao chă pơlôch đe păng pơm kơ kon bơngai lôch kơ pơngot rơwĕt, lôch kơ jĭ jăn păn hnong, lôch kơ sem bri pơlôch. 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ bre sư gơh pơm tơdrong noh truh kơ minh pah lăm puăn pah teh đak.

English: When He opened the fifth seal, I saw under the altar the souls of those who had been slain for the word of God and for the testimony which they held.
Bahnar: Lăp Kon Triu hek tơdra mă pơđăm, na inh 'bôh bơhngol lu bơngai lôch, lu sư oei tơ ala kơ chơnang soi lơlap lơlang. Lu bơngai noh sơ̆ đe pơlôch yua kơ lu sư ră roi tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: And they cried with a loud voice, saying, “How long, O Lord, holy and true, until You judge and avenge our blood on those who dwell on the earth?”
Bahnar: Đĭ dôm lu sư pơma pơret khan: “Ơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, Ih Kră Yang 'lơ̆ng tơpăt. Layơ Ih wă sek tơlang phak lu bơngai mă oei tơ ala teh pơlôch nhôn sơ̆?”

English: Then a white robe was given to each of them; and it was said to them that they should rest a little while longer, until both the number of their fellow servants and their brethren, who would be killed as they were, was completed.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh đe ăn rim 'nu kơ lu sư ao tai kok păng khan kơ lu sư thoi âu: “Gô 'biơ̆, gô tôm kơ lu bơngai mă trŏ kơ lôch thoi iĕm năm ră roi tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei, lu sư lôch 'mơ̆i, na phak lu bơngai mă pơlôch iĕm noh.”

English: I looked when He opened the sixth seal, and behold, there was a great earthquake; and the sun became black as sackcloth of hair, and the moon became like blood.
Bahnar: Kon Triu hek dơ̆ng tơdra mă tơdrâu, na inh 'bôh teh adrŏ tih mơ'nưt mơ'nat, măt 'năr mah jing măng mu suek dang che găm, măt khei lăp pơnil mah jing thoi pham.

English: And the stars of heaven fell to the earth, as a fig tree drops its late figs when it is shaken by a mighty wind.
Bahnar: Sơnglŏng huŏng đơ̆ng plĕnh kơdŭk kơdăk dang plei hơra đum hơlŭng kơ kial thu hơbŭt.

English: Then the sky receded as a scroll when it is rolled up, and every mountain and island was moved out of its place.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh inh 'bôh plĕnh tơlôm jing ưh pă 'bôh plĕnh dơ̆ng; lu thŭng thong, kông groi, bŏl đak tih iĕ kư̆m jing ưh pă 'bôh băt tơ yơ.

English: And the kings of the earth, the great men, the rich men, the commanders, the mighty men, every slave and every free man, hid themselves in the caves and in the rocks of the mountains
Bahnar: Lu bơngai ưh kơ lui tơ ala teh âu, mơ'nah pơm 'bok pơtao, mơ'nah pơm tih tơdrong nai, mơ'nah pơm tih linh, mơ'nah bơngai mơdrŏng, mơ'nah bơngai pran tih, đei mơ'nah đĭch đe, mơ'nah rơngei, đĭ lu sư hli tơrơ kơdâu ôn kơdih kơdih tơ hơgơp tơmo hơgơp teh.

English: and said to the mountains and rocks, “Fall on us and hide us from the face of Him who sits on the throne and from the wrath of the Lamb!
Bahnar: Đĭ lu sư khan: “Ơ kông, ơ tơmo, klơ̆p nhôn bĕ wă kơ nhôn huay pă 'bôh muh măt 'Bok Kei-Dei mă oei tơ tang-dŏ, hăm huay pă 'bôh muh măt Kon Triu hil kơ nhôn

English: For the great day of His wrath has come, and who is able to stand?”
Bahnar: yua kơ truh năr Sư hil kơ nhôn kơtang kơtĭt na bu kĕ sơ̆n.”

English: After these things I saw four angels standing at the four corners of the earth, holding the four winds of the earth, that the wind should not blow on the earth, on the sea, or on any tree.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh inh 'bôh puăn 'nu lu linh jang 'lơ̆ng, sư dơ̆ng tơ puăn pah mum teh đak. Lu sư wei puăn pah trong kial tơthu tơ teh đak, na sư wei kuă ăn kial tơthu pơrăm teh, pơrăm đak dơsĭ, pơrăm lu 'long.

English: Then I saw another angel ascending from the east, having the seal of the living God. And he cried with a loud voice to the four angels to whom it was granted to harm the earth and the sea
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh inh 'bôh dơ̆ng minh 'nu linh jang 'lơ̆ng nai sư tŏk đơ̆ng gah hơlĕch chĕp đŏng yâu wă chơ̆m tơ klĕng lu bơngai lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, 'Bok mă arih ling-lang. Na linh jang noh pơma 'bơ̆r re kơ lu linh jang 'lơ̆ng nai mă dơ̆ng tơ puăn pah mum teh đak mă 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn pơrăm teh, đak dơsĭ, lu 'long noh, khan

English: saying, “Do not harm the earth, the sea, or the trees till we have sealed the servants of our God on their foreheads.”
Bahnar: “Iĕm 'nĕ tam pơrăm teh, đak dơsĭ, lu 'long, gô nhôn chơ̆m đŏng yâu tôm kơ klĕng lu đĭch đam Kră Yang bơ̆n 'mơ̆i.”

English: And I heard the number of those who were sealed. One hundred and forty-four thousand of all the tribes of the children of Israel were sealed
Bahnar: Inh kơtơ̆ng đe khan sư wă chơ̆m đŏng yâu tơ klĕng rim kơ adrĕch adrung lu bơngai Isơrael truh kơ minh-hrĕng puăn-jĭt puăn-rơbâu 'nu đĭ-đăng.

English: of the tribe of Judah twelve thousand were sealed; of the tribe of Reuben twelve thousand were sealed; of the tribe of Gad twelve thousand were sealed
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng adrĕch adrung Juđa mơjĭt-'bar rơbâu 'nu; đơ̆ng adrĕch adrung Rubên mơjĭt-'bar rơbâu 'nu; đơ̆ng adrĕch adrung Gat mơjĭt-'bar rơbâu 'nu

English: of the tribe of Asher twelve thousand were sealed; of the tribe of Naphtali twelve thousand were sealed; of the tribe of Manasseh twelve thousand were sealed
Bahnar: đơ̆ng adrĕch adrung Aser mơjĭt-'bar rơbâu 'nu; đơ̆ng adrĕch adrung Naptali mơjĭt-'bar rơbâu 'nu; đơ̆ng adrĕch adrung Manase mơjĭt-'bar rơbâu 'nu

English: of the tribe of Simeon twelve thousand were sealed; of the tribe of Levi twelve thousand were sealed; of the tribe of Issachar twelve thousand were sealed
Bahnar: đơ̆ng adrĕch adrung Simiôn mơjĭt-'bar rơbâu 'nu; đơ̆ng adrĕch adrung Lêwi mơjĭt-'bar rơbâu 'nu; đơ̆ng adrĕch adrung Isakar mơjĭt-'bar rơbâu 'nu

English: of the tribe of Zebulun twelve thousand were sealed; of the tribe of Joseph twelve thousand were sealed; of the tribe of Benjamin twelve thousand were sealed.
Bahnar: đơ̆ng adrĕch adrung Sabalôn mơjĭt-'bar rơbâu 'nu; đơ̆ng adrĕch adrung Yôsep mơjĭt-'bar rơbâu 'nu; đơ̆ng adrĕch adrung Bênjamin mơjĭt-'bar rơbâu 'nu. Na lu sư chơ̆m đŏng yâu đĭ-đăng kơ lu bơngai noh.

English: After these things I looked, and behold, a great multitude which no one could number, of all nations, tribes, peoples, and tongues, standing before the throne and before the Lamb, clothed with white robes, with palm branches in their hands
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh inh 'bôh lơlap lơlang ưh kơ kĕ jô̆ ôh, yua kơ đơ̆ng rim dêh char, rim adrĕch adrung, rim khŭl bơngai, rim kơ nơ̆r pơma, lu sư dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp tang-dŏ 'Bok Kei-Dei păng Kon Triu. Lu sư tă ling hrŭk ao tai kok păng chĕp sơdrai hla.

English: and crying out with a loud voice, saying, “Salvation belongs to our God who sits on the throne, and to the Lamb!”
Bahnar: Lu sư pơma hơdai đĭ kơ minh tơpôl khan: “Ư-ang Kră Yang bơ̆n mă oei tơ tang-dŏ hăm ư-ang Kon Triu. Sư boih pơklaih bơ̆n ăn kơ bơ̆n hiôk-hian.”

English: All the angels stood around the throne and the elders and the four living creatures, and fell on their faces before the throne and worshiped God
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh đĭ kơ lu linh jang 'lơ̆ng dơ̆ng tăp dăr kơ tang-dŏ 'Bok Pơtao, tăp dăr kơ 'bar-jĭt puăn 'nu lu đe kră păng tăp dăr kơ puăn anăn sem noh, đĭ lu sư 'nap kơkuh kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei mă oei tơ tang-dŏ khan

English: saying: “Amen! Blessing and glory and wisdom, Thanksgiving and honor and power and might, Be to our God forever and ever. Amen.”
Bahnar: “Trŏ boih lu sư khan thoi noh. Bơnê kơ Ih Kră Yang nhôn 'Bok Kei-Dei. Ih 'lơ̆ng rŏ mơsêh mơyang pran tih hlôh wao tôm tơdrong, na trŏ kơ nhôn lui yom păng ư-ang Ih ling-lang ưh kơ layơ tôch. A-men.”

English: Then one of the elders answered, saying to me, “Who are these arrayed in white robes, and where did they come from?”
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh đei minh 'nu lăm 'bar-jĭt puăn 'nu lu đe kră ei jet inh khan: “Ih hăm băt kơ lu bơngai mă hrŭk ao tai kok noh păng ih hăm băt kơ lu sư đơ̆ng yơ?”

English: And I said to him, “Sir, you know.” So he said to me, “These are the ones who come out of the great tribulation, and washed their robes and made them white in the blood of the Lamb.
Bahnar: Na inh tơl sư thoi âu: “Ơ 'bok, ih băt boih tơdrong 'noh.” Na sư roi kơ inh thoi âu: “Lu bơngai 'noh sơ̆ lu sư đei tơdrong truh đe pơm kơnê̆ kơ lu sư dêh, lu sư adrin lui truh lôch. Lu sư pih ao tơ pham Kon Triu, kok 'lơ̆ng boih.

English: Therefore they are before the throne of God, and serve Him day and night in His temple. And He who sits on the throne will dwell among them.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na dang ei lu sư oei 'bơ̆t anăp tang-dŏ 'Bok Kei-Dei, kơkuh kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei ling-lang măng năr tơ noh. Pơtao bơ̆n 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m oei hơdai lu sư. Lu sư huay pă đei tơdrong truh dơ̆ng boih.

English: They shall neither hunger anymore nor thirst anymore; the sun shall not strike them, nor any heat
Bahnar: Lu sư ưh pă layơ pơngot dah ol kơ đak, ưh pă layơ hli kơ bơyan tŏ bơyan phang.

English: for the Lamb who is in the midst of the throne will shepherd them and lead them to living fountains of waters. And God will wipe away every tear from their eyes.”
Bahnar: Kon Triu oei hơdai Pơtao bơ̆n 'Bok Kei-Dei, Sư wei-lăng lu đe noh, anhăk ba lu sư truh boih tơ tu đak mă ăn kơ kon bơngai arih ling-lang. 'Bok Kei-Dei sut đak măt lu sư huay pă nhơ̆m hmoi boih.”

English: When He opened the seventh seal, there was silence in heaven for about half an hour.
Bahnar: Lăp Kon Triu hek tơdra mă tơpơh, kơplah ei tơ plĕnh ti ưh kơ đei kon kiơ pơma, thĕng hreh đĕch, đunh dang minh puăt jơ.

English: And I saw the seven angels who stand before God, and to them were given seven trumpets.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh inh 'bôh tơpơh 'nu linh jang 'lơ̆ng mă juăt kơ dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp 'Bok Kei-Dei, na lu sư dơ̆ng. Đe đei ăn kơ lu sư tơpơh tŏ keng.

English: Then another angel, having a golden censer, came and stood at the altar. He was given much incense, that he should offer it with the prayers of all the saints upon the golden altar which was before the throne.
Bahnar: Đei minh 'nu linh jang nai dơ̆ng, sư dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp chơnang soi, sư chĕp minh pôm kơlăm maih păng đe ăn kơ sư minh achô̆ ŭnh nhang wă soh kơplah đĭ-đăng bơngai lui oei krao khan, wă kơ 'bâu phu. Na sư pơyơ̆r ŭnh nhang noh kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei 'măn 'bơ̆t chơnang soi tơklă tang-dŏ 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: And the smoke of the incense, with the prayers of the saints, ascended before God from the angel’s hand.
Bahnar: Lăp linh jang ei soh ŭnh nhang ei boih na 'nhui ŭnh nhang noh tŏk 'bâu phu jơ̆p-jang kơ lu bơngai lui oei krao khan, tŏk truh tơ 'Bok Kei-Dei. 'Noh wă pơtih gia kơ tơdrong bơngai lui krao khan kơtơ̆ng truh tơ 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Then the angel took the censer, filled it with fire from the altar, and threw it to the earth. And there were noises, thunderings, lightnings, and an earthquake.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh sư kep iŏk ŭnh ngar đơ̆ng chơnang soi tah lăm kơlăm maih klơ̆m hloi tơ teh, na đei grơ̆m glaih tơdrăng kơmlat kơchêr kơchar păng đei teh adrŏ mơ'nưt mơ'nat.

English: So the seven angels who had the seven trumpets prepared themselves to sound.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh na tơpơh 'nu linh jang mă chĕp tơpơh tŏ keng noh hei lu sư kơchăng wă hlôm.

English: The first angel sounded: And hail and fire followed, mingled with blood, and they were thrown to the earth. And a third of the trees were burned up, and all green grass was burned up.
Bahnar: Lăp linh jang 'lơ̆ng mă mônh hlôm keng, na đei hloi 'mi prĕl tih tơpă. Păng đei ŭnh hăm pham huŏng đơ̆ng plĕnh truh tơ teh, ŭnh sa pơđĭ minh lăm pêng pah teh đak. Lu 'long, ŭnh sa đĭ minh lăm pêng pah, tôm kơ 'nhĕt kư̆m lei-lăi sa pơgoh hloi.

English: Then the second angel sounded: And something like a great mountain burning with fire was thrown into the sea, and a third of the sea became blood.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng rŏng kơ noh đei minh 'nu linh jang mă 'bar hlôm keng, na inh 'bôh minh pôm kơtuŏl ŭnh tih tŏ kông huŏng đơ̆ng plĕnh hơtat tơ đak dơsĭ.

English: And a third of the living creatures in the sea died, and a third of the ships were destroyed.
Bahnar: Na minh lăm pêng pah đak dơsĭ jing pham đĭ. Dôm lu kon sem mă arih lăm đak dơsĭ lôch đĭ minh lăm pêng. Lu duk, lu thŏng-nan đe juăt kơ yua tơ đak dơsĭ kư̆m pơchah răm đĭ minh lăm pêng pah oei huay 'bar pah.

English: Then the third angel sounded: And a great star fell from heaven, burning like a torch, and it fell on a third of the rivers and on the springs of water.
Bahnar: Linh jang 'lơ̆ng mă pêng hlôm keng, inh 'bôh minh pôm sơnglŏng tih khơ̆ng thoi ŭnh huŏng đơ̆ng plĕnh jruh tơ minh lăm pêng pah đak krong, minh lăm pêng pah rim kơ tu đak.

English: The name of the star is Wormwood. A third of the waters became wormwood, and many men died from the water, because it was made bitter.
Bahnar: Đe anăn sơnglŏng ei sơnglŏng tăng, yua kơ minh lăm pêng pah dôm lu thong đak noh, đei minh pah tăng ngăl. Đei lơlap lơlang bơngai lôch yua kơ nhă đak tăng ei, đak ei tăng dêh tơpă.

English: Then the fourth angel sounded: And a third of the sun was struck, a third of the moon, and a third of the stars, so that a third of them were darkened. A third of the day did not shine, and likewise the night.
Bahnar: Linh jang mă puăn hlôm keng, đei minh pah lăm pêng pah măt 'năr, đei minh pah lăm pêng pah măt khei, đei minh pah lăm pêng pah lu sơnglŏng jing măng mu minh pah. Đĭ lu sư jing ưh pă gan hơdah boih; 'noh jĭ kơ'năr ră, rai kơmăng rai loi.

English: And I looked, and I heard an angel flying through the midst of heaven, saying with a loud voice, “Woe, woe, woe to the inhabitants of the earth, because of the remaining blasts of the trumpet of the three angels who are about to sound!”
Bahnar: Inh 'bôh păng kơtơ̆ng minh pôm sem klang păr tŏk-bŏk rơwơ̆ng ti, sư pơma 'bơ̆r re khan: “Ô glăi, ô glăi, ô glăi, lu bơngai mă oei tơ teh, pă 'biơ̆ pêng 'nu linh jang 'lơ̆ng hlôm keng wă pơrăm iĕm.”

English: Then the fifth angel sounded: And I saw a star fallen from heaven to the earth. To him was given the key to the bottomless pit.
Bahnar: Lăp linh jang 'lơ̆ng mă pơđăm hlôm keng, inh 'bôh minh pôm sơnglŏng đơ̆ng plĕnh đêl huŏng tơ teh. Đe ăn kơ sơnglŏng noh khuă wă pơih 'măng sơlŭng jrŭ.

English: And he opened the bottomless pit, and smoke arose out of the pit like the smoke of a great furnace. So the sun and the air were darkened because of the smoke of the pit.
Bahnar: Lăp sơnglŏng ei iŏk khuă pơih 'măng sơlŭng jrŭ noh boih, na đei hloi 'nhui tŏk đơ̆ng sơlŭng noh tơ plĕnh kơŭl hyôi thoi đơ̆ng tơnuh ŭnh tih, măt 'năr anê̆ rơwơ̆ng mah glĭp măng mu.

English: Then out of the smoke locusts came upon the earth. And to them was given power, as the scorpions of the earth have power.
Bahnar: 'Blă 'noh đei lep păr tŏk kiơ̆ 'nhui lĕch đơ̆ng sơlŭng noh năm jơ̆p-jang kơ teh đak. Lep noh gơh sôch thoi aguăt.

English: They were commanded not to harm the grass of the earth, or any green thing, or any tree, but only those men who do not have the seal of God on their foreheads.
Bahnar: Lep noh 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ ăn sư sa 'nhĕt, sa 'ba, dah sa hla 'long ôh. Sư ăn lep noh năm chă sôch kon bơngai mă ưh kơ lui, ưh kơ đei chơ̆m đŏng yâu 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ klĕng sư.

English: And they were not given authority to kill them, but to torment them for five months. Their torment was like the torment of a scorpion when it strikes a man.
Bahnar: Lep noh 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ ăn sư sôch kon bơngai mah truh lôch ôh, Sư ăn sôch pơmat lu bơngai mă ưh kơ lui lăm pơđăm khei. Lep noh sôch jĭ dang aguăt sôch.

English: In those days men will seek death and will not find it; they will desire to die, and death will flee from them.
Bahnar: Kơplah năr ei kơnh đĭ-đăng kon bơngai hmăng kơ dah lôch đĕch boih. Lu sư apơi kơ lôch, mă-lei ưh kơ lôch oei arih.

English: The shape of the locusts was like horses prepared for battle. On their heads were crowns of something like gold, and their faces were like the faces of men.
Bahnar: Lep noh mưh sư wă năm blah sôch đe, sư năm đĭ kơ tơpôl pơrĕng, thoi aseh juăt kơ năm tơblah. Tơ kơ̆l lu sư lăng thoi yơ̆l môk maih ngăl, muh măt lu sư thoi muh măt kon bơngai.

English: They had hair like women’s hair, and their teeth were like lions’ teeth.
Bahnar: Sŏk lu sư thoi sŏk bơngai drŏ-kăn, grĕng lu sư thoi grĕng dăm-brang.

English: And they had breastplates like breastplates of iron, and the sound of their wings was like the sound of chariots with many horses running into battle.
Bahnar: Ao lu sư hrŭk thoi ao mam đe hrŭk; lu sư tơtuh pơnăr jơwa dang aseh lơ dui gre năm tơblah.

English: They had tails like scorpions, and there were stings in their tails. Their power was to hurt men five months.
Bahnar: Kiĕng sư thoi kiĕng aguăt, sơmôch sư sôch đe 'bơ̆t kiĕng. Lu sư năm blah sôch kon bơngai lăm pơđăm khei, pơm kơ kon bơngai jĭ jăn pơmat-tat.

English: And they had as king over them the angel of the bottomless pit, whose name in Hebrew is Abaddon, but in Greek he has the name Apollyon.
Bahnar: Lu sư đei yŏng pơgơ̆r kơdih, yŏng lu sư ei jĭ yang pơgơ̆r sơlŭng jrŭ, anăn sư lăm nơ̆r Hêbrơ khan Abadon; tơ̆ng kiơ̆ kơ nơ̆r Grĕk khan Apôliôn wă khan yang chă blah pơrăm đe.

English: One woe is past. Behold, still two more woes are coming after these things.
Bahnar: Tơdrong gleh truh mă mônh tôch dôm noh boih, oei pă 'bar tơdrong dơ̆ng.

English: Then the sixth angel sounded: And I heard a voice from the four horns of the golden altar which is before God
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh linh jang mă tơdrâu sư hlôm keng, na inh kơtơ̆ng 'bơ̆r pơma đơ̆ng lăm puăn tŏ ake chăt 'bơ̆t puăn pah mum chơnang soi maih đe 'măn 'bơ̆t anăp 'Bok Kei-Dei noh

English: saying to the sixth angel who had the trumpet, “Release the four angels who are bound at the great river Euphrates.”
Bahnar: sư pơma kơ linh jang mă tơdrâu thoi âu: “Ih năm yaih achăng puăn 'nu yang mă đe chô̆ kron lu sư tơ jih đak krong Êphrat.”

English: So the four angels, who had been prepared for the hour and day and month and year, were released to kill a third of mankind.
Bahnar: Na linh jang mă tơdrâu ei năm yaih achăng hloi puăn 'nu yang mă đe chô̆ kron ei. Puăn 'nu yang ei wă chă pơlôch pơrăm đe. Na tơdrong sư wă pơlôch pơrăm đe noh sư hơmet lê̆ đơ̆ng sơ̆ boih, sư khŏm wă pơlôch pơrăm kon bơngai rim adrĕch adrung truh kơ minh pôm teh đak kơdih lăm pêng tŏ teh đak, dang ei khei âu sơnăm âu hloi.

English: Now the number of the army of the horsemen was two hundred million; I heard the number of them.
Bahnar: Puăn 'nu yang ei đei linh lơ tơpă tă hao aseh ngăl, đe khan đei 'bar-hrĕng trĭu 'nu.

English: And thus I saw the horses in the vision: those who sat on them had breastplates of fiery red, hyacinth blue, and sulfur yellow; and the heads of the horses were like the heads of lions; and out of their mouths came fire, smoke, and brimstone.
Bahnar: Lăm tơdrong mă tơ'bôh kơ inh noh, inh đei 'bôh lu linh hao aseh ei tă hrŭk ao mam 'brê thoi pla ŭnh, 'nhui ŭnh, tơmo ŭnh dreng. Kơ̆l aseh ei thoi kơ̆l dăm-brang; sư đei pla ŭnh, 'nhui ŭnh păng tơmo ŭnh dreng lĕch 'nhui 'bâu chhok hơ̆-hang, kon bơngai hơ'nơ̆k lôch yua kơ sư pruih tơlĕch đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r sư.

English: By these three plagues a third of mankind was killed—by the fire and the smoke and the brimstone which came out of their mouths.
Bahnar: Pêng tơdrong sơmôch pơlôch pơrăm kon bơngai noh gơh pơlôch dang minh pah lăm pêng pah teh đak, kon bơngai lôch.

English: For their power is in their mouth and in their tails; for their tails are like serpents, having heads; and with them they do harm.
Bahnar: Lu aseh ei kư̆m gơh pơlôch pơrăm đe păng kiĕng sư, yua kơ kiĕng sư đei kơ̆l thoi 'bih gơh choh pơlôch kon bơngai.

English: But the rest of mankind, who were not killed by these plagues, did not repent of the works of their hands, that they should not worship demons, and idols of gold, silver, brass, stone, and wood, which can neither see nor hear nor walk.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai mă huay truh kơ tơdrong aseh pơrăm, lu sư oei ưh kơ chu tơbral 'mơ̆i. Lu sư oei kơkuh kơ yang kơnê̆, pơm kơdih rup yang păng maih păng hu păng mam kong păng tơmo dah păng 'long. Pơm kơdih rup mă ưh kơ 'bôh, ưh kơ kơtơ̆ng, ưh kơ gơh yak, 'noh boih kơkuh khan yang.

English: And they did not repent of their murders or their sorceries or their sexual immorality or their thefts.
Bahnar: Tơdrong lu sư pơlôch đe kư̆m ưh kơ chu tơbral, oei pơlôch đe hơnơ̆ng, oei pơm pơjâu chă sol đe, ngôi pơyô kư̆ kă, chă tơtông tơmam đe.

English: I saw still another mighty angel coming down from heaven, clothed with a cloud. And a rainbow was on his head, his face was like the sun, and his feet like pillars of fire.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh dơ̆ng inh 'bôh minh 'nu linh jang 'lơ̆ng nai, sư jur đơ̆ng plĕnh đei hơmơ̆l gom akâu sư thoi hrŭk ao, sư pran tih. Păng đei plĕnh chro wăr kơpal kơ̆l sư; muh măt sư lăng mơnhal dang măt 'năr, jơ̆ng sư 'bak đum thoi pla ŭnh.

English: He had a little book open in his hand. And he set his right foot on the sea and his left foot on the land
Bahnar: Ti sư chĕp minh sơnôm hla bơar iĕ mă bơlang lê̆ boih. Jơ̆ng sư gah 'ma juă kơpal đak dơsĭ, jơ̆ng sư gah 'ngiĕo juă kơpal teh.

English: and cried with a loud voice, as when a lion roars. When he cried out, seven thunders uttered their voices.
Bahnar: Sư tơjroh re dêh dang 'bơ̆r kiĕk arum. Đang sư tơjroh boih đei hloi grơ̆m glaih tơdrăng re jơwa tơpơh 'măng.

English: Now when the seven thunders uttered their voices, I was about to write; but I heard a voice from heaven saying to me, “Seal up the things which the seven thunders uttered, and do not write them.”
Bahnar: Inh kơtơ̆ng grơ̆m glaih tơdrăng jơwa re tơpơh 'măng thoi noh inh wă chih iŏk hloi ră, mă-lei đei nơ̆r đơ̆ng plĕnh kuă ăn inh chih iŏk, Sư khan kơ inh thoi âu: “Ih 'nĕ kơ chih iŏk tơdrong grơ̆m glaih jơwa noh, ih ôn đĕch 'nĕ roi kơ đe.”

English: The angel whom I saw standing on the sea and on the land raised up his hand to heaven
Bahnar: Na linh jang mă inh 'bôh sư dơ̆ng minh pah jơ̆ng tơ đak dơsĭ minh pah tơ kơpal teh noh hei, sư yơ̆r ti gah 'ma

English: and swore by Him who lives forever and ever, who created heaven and the things that are in it, the earth and the things that are in it, and the sea and the things that are in it, that there should be delay no longer
Bahnar: na sư pơma pơsĭt kơ đe 'bơ̆t anăp 'Bok Kei-Dei Kră Yang arih ling-lang ưh kơ đei layơ tôch, sư pơjing plĕnh tôm tơdrong kơpal plĕnh, pơjing teh tôm tơdrong kơpal teh, pơjing đak dơsĭ tôm tơdrong lăm đak dơsĭ. Na tơdrong sư pơma pơsĭt kơ đe noh khan: “'Bok Kei-Dei ưh pă wă gô dơ̆ng boih.

English: but in the days of the sounding of the seventh angel, when he is about to sound, the mystery of God would be finished, as He declared to His servants the prophets.
Bahnar: Lăp năr linh jang 'lơ̆ng mă tơpơh hlôm keng, na dôm tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei wơh lu jơ̆ng 'bang sư roi tơbăt ăn kơ bơ̆n mă sơ̆, mă dang ei, dôm tơdrong noh gô 'blep đei thoi noh tơpă.”

English: Then the voice which I heard from heaven spoke to me again and said, “Go, take the little book which is open in the hand of the angel who stands on the sea and on the earth.”
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh inh kơtơ̆ng dơ̆ng nơ̆r mă pơma kơ inh đơ̆ng plĕnh hei, Sư pơma kơ inh thoi âu: “Ih năm iŏk hla bơar đơ̆ng ti linh jang 'lơ̆ng mă bơlang lê̆ boih mă sư dơ̆ng jơ̆ng minh pah tơ đak dơsĭ minh pah tơ kơpal teh noh.”

English: So I went to the angel and said to him, “Give me the little book.” And he said to me, “Take and eat it; and it will make your stomach bitter, but it will be as sweet as honey in your mouth.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh na inh năm hloi tơ linh jang ei păng apinh sư ăn kơ inh hla bơar iĕ mă sư bơlang noh. Na sư khan kơ inh thoi âu: “Ih iŏk hla bơar âu luŏn sa hloi na ih gô mơn kơ tăng lăm klak ih, mă-lei lăm 'bơ̆r ih, ih mơn kơ 'ngam thoi đak sut.”

English: Then I took the little book out of the angel’s hand and ate it, and it was as sweet as honey in my mouth. But when I had eaten it, my stomach became bitter.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na inh iŏk hla bơar iĕ noh đơ̆ng ti linh jang, na luŏn sa hloi. Lăm 'bơ̆r inh, inh mơn kơ 'ngam thoi đak sut; mưh inh luŏn hlôi boih, lăm klak inh, inh mơn kơ tăng.

English: And he said to me, “You must prophesy again about many peoples, nations, tongues, and kings.”
Bahnar: Na sư khan kơ inh dơ̆ng thoi âu: “Ih athei pơtruh kơ lơ dêh char, teh đak, nơ̆r pơma khŭl kon bơngai păng lu 'bok pơtao kơ tơdrong wă truh kơ lu sư.”

English: Then I was given a reed like a measuring rod. And the angel stood, saying, “Rise and measure the temple of God, the altar, and those who worship there.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh đe kư̆m ăn kơ inh minh jăl 'long thưk thoi 'long jra. Sư khan kơ inh thoi âu: “Inh wă kơ ih năm pơtŏ hnam 'Bok Kei-Dei tơm păng pơtŏ chơnang soi, klaih kơ noh ih jô̆ lăng đei dôm hrĕng 'nu lu bơngai mă oei krao khan lăm noh.

English: But leave out the court which is outside the temple, and do not measure it, for it has been given to the Gentiles. And they will tread the holy city underfoot for forty-two months.
Bahnar: Gah tơ 'ngoaih hnam tơ cham ih lê̆ kơ pơtŏ kư̆m bưh, yua kơ cham noh đe pơjao ăn kơ lu bơngai oei tơ teh âu juă lăm pơlei 'lơ̆ng wă khan Pơlei Jêrusalem kơplah lăm puăn-jĭt 'bar khei.

English: And I will give power to my two witnesses, and they will prophesy one thousand two hundred and sixty days, clothed in sackcloth.”
Bahnar: Na inh wă ăn 'bar 'nu bơngai hrŭk ao 'bi năm chă pơtruh kơ đe tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei kơplah lăm minh-rơbâu 'bar-hrĕng tơdrâu-jĭt năr.”

English: These are the two olive trees and the two lampstands standing before the God of the earth.
Bahnar: Bre sư thoi 'bar tơnơm 'long Ôliwơ păng 'bar tŏ jơ̆ng kơđeng đe pơdơ̆ng lê̆ 'bơ̆t anăp 'Bok Kei-Dei Kră Yang plĕnh teh.

English: And if anyone wants to harm them, fire proceeds from their mouth and devours their enemies. And if anyone wants to harm them, he must be killed in this manner.
Bahnar: Tơ̆ng bơngai bu wă pơrăm bre sư, bre sư tơlĕch ŭnh đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r bre sư, na ŭnh noh sa hloi bơngai mă wă pơrăm bre sư noh. Thoi noh tơ̆ng bu wă pơrăm bre sư, bơngai noh sư 'maih chă tơdrong lôch.

English: These have power to shut heaven, so that no rain falls in the days of their prophecy; and they have power over waters to turn them to blood, and to strike the earth with all plagues, as often as they desire.
Bahnar: Bre sư gơh chĭt đak 'mi đơ̆ng plĕnh kuă ăn 'mi kơplah bre sư oei chă năm pơtruh kơ đe nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei. Bre sư kư̆m gơh sơkat kơ đak jing pham păng bre sư kư̆m gơh pơm kơ bơngai mă ưh kơ chu jĭ pơmat-tat gô mơ̆ng kơ bre sư wă.

English: When they finish their testimony, the beast that ascends out of the bottomless pit will make war against them, overcome them, and kill them.
Bahnar: Lăp bre sư năm chă pơtruh kơ đe tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei tôm boih, na đei minh pôm sem brem kơnê̆ pơplŏng lĕch đơ̆ng sơlŭng jrŭ blah pơlôch bre sư, lôch hloi.

English: And their dead bodies will lie in the street of the great city which spiritually is called Sodom and Egypt, where also our Lord was crucified.
Bahnar: Bre sư pơ̆k lôch 'bơ̆t tŏk-bŏk trong pơlei tih, mă đe anăn ngôi Pơlei Sôđôm hăm dêh Êyiptơ, pơlei mă đe pơ̆ng pơlôch Yŏng bre sư tơ 'long pơglang sơ̆.

English: Then those from the peoples, tribes, tongues, and nations will see their dead bodies three-and-a-half days, and not allow their dead bodies to be put into graves.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng kon tơring tơrang rim dêh, rim teh đak, rim nơ̆r pơma wang luh năm lăng bre sư lôch, kuă ăn 'bŭ bre sư truh tơ pêng năr minh puăt.

English: And those who dwell on the earth will rejoice over them, make merry, and send gifts to one another, because these two prophets tormented those who dwell on the earth.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng bơngai ưh kơ lăp đon kơ bre sư, khan bre sư pơjĭ jơhngơ̆m đon đe. Na lăp đe 'bôh bre sư lôch boih, đĭ rim măt bơngai 'nă hal ngôi pơchơt dih băl, pơm chă tơăn băl tơmam.

English: Now after the three-and-a-half days the breath of life from God entered them, and they stood on their feet, and great fear fell on those who saw them.
Bahnar: Lăp kơtĕch pêng năr minh puăt na 'Bok Kei-Dei tơiung arih bre sư, ăn kơ bre sư gơh dui jơhngơ̆m klaih kơ noh iung hloi. Lu đe mă 'bôh bre sư iung arih hli tơrơ dêh.

English: And they heard a loud voice from heaven saying to them, “Come up here.” And they ascended to heaven in a cloud, and their enemies saw them.
Bahnar: Bre sư kơtơ̆ng nơ̆r pơma re tơ plĕnh khan: “Ơ bre noh, tŏk tơ âu bĕ.” Na bre sư tŏk hloi tơ plĕnh hơmơ̆l hiŏng bre sư. Dôm lu bơngai mă ayăt kơ bre sư 'bôh bre sư tŏk mơ̆n.

English: In the same hour there was a great earthquake, and a tenth of the city fell. In the earthquake seven thousand people were killed, and the rest were afraid and gave glory to the God of heaven.
Bahnar: Kơtă ei đei hloi teh adrŏ tih, mơjĭt tŏ kueng pơlei pơchah răm minh pah kueng. Đei tơpơh-rơbâu 'nu bơngai lôch yua kơ teh adrŏ noh. Lu bơngai mă oei arih huay truh tơdrong noh, lu sư hli tơrơ dêh, na pơma ư-ang Kră Yang 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ plĕnh.

English: The second woe is past. Behold, the third woe is coming quickly.
Bahnar: Tơdrong gleh truh mă 'bar tôch dôm noh boih, oei pă minh tơdrong wă truh dơ̆ng.

English: Then the seventh angel sounded: And there were loud voices in heaven, saying, “The kingdoms of this world have become the kingdoms of our Lord and of His Christ, and He shall reign forever and ever!”
Bahnar: Truh tơ linh jang 'lơ̆ng mă tơpơh hlôm keng, đei nơ̆r pơma re tơ plĕnh khan: “Dang ei tôm kơ adrĕch adrung kon bơngai ala teh Kră Yang bơ̆n pơgơ̆r ngăl boih. Sư kư̆m ăn kơ 'Bok Krist pơgơ̆r đĭ kơ adrĕch adrung kon bơngai mơ̆n, Sư pơgơ̆r ling-lang ưh kơ layơ tôch.”

English: And the twenty-four elders who sat before God on their thrones fell on their faces and worshiped God
Bahnar: 'Bar-jĭt puăn 'nu lu đe kră mă oei tơ tang-dŏ tăp dăr kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei 'nap kơkuh kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei

English: saying: “We give You thanks, O Lord God Almighty, The One who is and who was and who is to come, Because You have taken Your great power and reigned.
Bahnar: păng khan: “Ơ 'Bok Kei-Dei Kră Yang Tih Hloh, Ih mơsêh mơyang tih-tin mă đei đơ̆ng sơ̆ khơ̆ dang ei, bơnê kơ Ih, nhôn băt kơ Ih wă pơgơ̆r tôm tơdrong tơpă boih.

English: The nations were angry, and Your wrath has come, And the time of the dead, that they should be judged, And that You should reward Your servants the prophets and the saints, And those who fear Your name, small and great, And should destroy those who destroy the earth.”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai ala teh mă ưh kơ lui hil areh kơ Ih, mă-lei dang ei kư̆m truh boih tơdrong Ih hil areh kơ lu sư wă phak lu sư păng wă sek tơlang lu bơngai lôch. Gah lu đĭch đam mă pơtruh nơ̆r Ih, lu kon Ih, lu băt lui yom hli kơ Ih, Ih gô apah lu sư mă sư pơm tih pơm iĕ. Gah lu bơngai mă ưh kơ lui chă pơrăm đe tơ ala teh, Ih gô pơrăm lu sư mơ̆n.”

English: Then the temple of God was opened in heaven, and the ark of His covenant was seen in His temple. And there were lightnings, noises, thunderings, an earthquake, and great hail.
Bahnar: Inh 'bôh hnam 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ plĕnh ti pơih 'măng, na inh 'bôh hom tih đe tah tơmo lat chih tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă kơ kon bơngai sơ̆. Na đei grơ̆m glaih tơdrăng kơmlat kơchêr kơchar, teh adrŏ mơ'nưt mơ'nat păng 'mi pru prĕl tih.

English: Now a great sign appeared in heaven: a woman clothed with the sun, with the moon under her feet, and on her head a garland of twelve stars.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh đei tơdrong tơ plĕnh ti hlĭch tơpă, đei minh 'nu bơngai drŏ-kăn hrŭk ao hơdah dang măt 'năr, tơ jơ̆ng sư đei măt khei. Tơ kơ̆l sư yơ̆l môk đei mơjĭt-'bar tŏ sơnglŏng.

English: Then being with child, she cried out in labor and in pain to give birth.
Bahnar: Sư jĭ anăp, sư nŏng kơ hmoi kơ jĭ anăp sư chang dah tơpŭ ră.

English: And another sign appeared in heaven: behold, a great, fiery red dragon having seven heads and ten horns, and seven diadems on his heads.
Bahnar: Na tơ plĕnh đei tơdrong nai dơ̆ng mơ̆n kư̆m hlĭch bơ̆n ưh kơ biơh 'bôh. Đei minh pôm yă-grai 'brê tih krưp dêh. Sư đei tơpơh tŏ kơ̆l, mơjĭt tŏ ake păng yơ̆l tơpơh tŏ môk pơtao tơ kơ̆l sư.

English: His tail drew a third of the stars of heaven and threw them to the earth. And the dragon stood before the woman who was ready to give birth, to devour her Child as soon as it was born.
Bahnar: Kiĕng sư hor ba lu sơnglŏng đơ̆ng plĕnh huŏng tơ teh minh pah lăm pêng. Klaih kơ noh na sư năm 'bơ̆t anăp bơngai drŏ-kăn mă jĭ anăp wă tơpŭ noh, sư răp gô bơngai noh tơpŭ wă luŏn sa kon nge sư.

English: She bore a male Child who was to rule all nations with a rod of iron. And her Child was caught up to God and His throne.
Bahnar: Lăp bơngai noh tơpŭ kon drŏ-nglo, na 'Bok Kei-Dei iŏk atŏk hloi kon nge 'noh tơ plĕnh, yua kơ kon nge 'noh ning-mônh Sư gô pơm 'Bok Pơgơ̆r tôm kơ dêh char, chĕp 'long jra mam.

English: Then the woman fled into the wilderness, where she has a place prepared by God, that they should feed her there one thousand two hundred and sixty days.
Bahnar: Na bơngai drŏ-kăn ei kơdâu ôn hloi akâu sư tơ anih kueng chơngue, tơ anih mă 'Bok Kei-Dei hơmet lê̆ kơ sư boih. 'Bok Kei-Dei hiĕm 'me sư tơ noh kơplah minh-rơbâu 'bar-hrĕng tơdrâu-jĭt năr.

English: And war broke out in heaven: Michael and his angels fought with the dragon; and the dragon and his angels fought
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh na đei tơdrong tơblah tơ plĕnh ti. Mikael pơm kră wei-lăng lu linh jang 'lơ̆ng, sư krao đĭ-đăng lu linh sư tơblah păng linh yă-grai păng akâu yă-grai kơdih hai.

English: but they did not prevail, nor was a place found for them in heaven any longer.
Bahnar: Na jei lu linh Mikael. Yă-grai păng lu linh sư thuơ boih na ưh pă gơh oei tơ plĕnh ti dơ̆ng.

English: So the great dragon was cast out, that serpent of old, called the Devil and Satan, who deceives the whole world; he was cast to the earth, and his angels were cast out with him.
Bahnar: Na đe tơhuŏng sư păng đĭ lu linh sư tơ teh. Prao noh boih 'bih so sơ̆ mă đe anăn yŏng yang sơmăt păng yang Satan. Sư pơhlŭ đe jơ̆p kơ teh đak. Đe blah tơhuŏng sư păng lu linh sư đơ̆ng plĕnh tơ teh.

English: Then I heard a loud voice saying in heaven, “Now salvation, and strength, and the kingdom of our God, and the power of His Christ have come, for the accuser of our brethren, who accused them before our God day and night, has been cast down.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh na inh kơtơ̆ng 'bơ̆r pơma re tơ plĕnh ti khan: “Dang ei Kră Yang bơ̆n 'Bok Kei-Dei blah dŏng kon bơngai boih, Sư yua tơdrong mơsêh mơyang Sư blah iŏk kon bơngai đơ̆ng yang Satan pơgơ̆r, na Sư wă pơgơ̆r kơdih. Na Sư kư̆m ăn kơ 'Bok Krist pơgơ̆r mơ̆n, yua kơ yang Satan thuơ huŏng tơ teh boih. Sư boih nŏng kơ pơma 'bơ̆t anăp 'Bok Kei-Dei jô̆ kơ lu buăl bơ̆n khan bơngai yoch bơngai kơnê̆ wă kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei tŭk lu buăl bơ̆n.

English: And they overcame him by the blood of the Lamb and by the word of their testimony, and they did not love their lives to the death.
Bahnar: Mă-lei jei lu buăl bơ̆n, yua kơ lu sư gơnang kơ Kon Triu 'Bok Kei-Dei lôch tuh pham tang lu sư, păng lu sư adrin ră roi tơdrong Kon Triu. Lu sư ưh kơ 'mêm kơ akâu ôh, lôch bưh arih bưh.

English: Therefore rejoice, O heavens, and you who dwell in them! Woe to the inhabitants of the earth and the sea! For the devil has come down to you, having great wrath, because he knows that he has a short time.”
Bahnar: Thoi noh na ơ lu mă oei tơ plĕnh, gah lu iĕm hiôk boih, mă-lei mơnat kơ lu đe mă oei tơ teh păng oei tơ đak dơsĭ, yua kơ yang Satan huŏng tơ teh truh tơ lu sư boih. Satan jơhngơ̆m sư kơnê̆ 'maih hil 'maih areh kơ đe, yua kơ sư băt kơdih khei 'năr sư tơ teh ưh pă đunh boih.”

English: Now when the dragon saw that he had been cast to the earth, he persecuted the woman who gave birth to the male Child.
Bahnar: Yă-grai ei sư ơh kơ đe blah tơhuŏng sư tơ teh boih, na sư druh sa bơngai drŏ-kăn mă tơpŭ kon nge drŏ-nglo noh hei.

English: But the woman was given two wings of a great eagle, that she might fly into the wilderness to her place, where she is nourished for a time and times and half a time, from the presence of the serpent.
Bahnar: Mă-lei 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ bơngai drŏ-kăn ei minh blah ao pơnăr klang tih, wă kơ sư gơh păr jăk tơ anih kueng chơngue, tơ anih mă 'Bok Kei-Dei gô hiĕm 'me sư kơplah pêng sơnăm minh puăt. Na yă-grai ei sư tôch đon ưh kơ gơh pơm kiơ kơ sư.

English: So the serpent spewed water out of his mouth like a flood after the woman, that he might cause her to be carried away by the flood.
Bahnar: Na yă-grai ei sư pruh tơlĕch đak đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r sư jing đak krong tih druh đơ̆ng rŏng bơngai drŏ-kăn ei wă kơ đak krong noh pơhoch sư ră.

English: But the earth helped the woman, and the earth opened its mouth and swallowed up the flood which the dragon had spewed out of his mouth.
Bahnar: Mă-lei đei teh sa đak tơgŭm bơngai drŏ-kăn ei, teh ei ha 'bơ̆r luŏn sa pơđĭ đak krong mă đêl yă-grai pruh noh.

English: And the dragon was enraged with the woman, and he went to make war with the rest of her offspring, who keep the commandments of God and have the testimony of Jesus Christ.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na yă-grai ei sư ơh kơ druh sa bơngai drŏ-kăn ei ưh kơ đei, na sư năm blah lu kon sâu bơngai drŏ-kăn ei, wă khan lu bơngai lui kiơ̆ nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă păng lu bơngai ră roi tơdrong Yêsu.
Na yă-grai ei dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t pơlao chuơh tơ jih đak dơsĭ.

English: Then I stood on the sand of the sea. And I saw a beast rising up out of the sea, having seven heads and ten horns, and on his horns ten crowns, and on his heads a blasphemous name.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh inh 'bôh minh pôm sem brem lĕch đơ̆ng đak dơsĭ. Sem ei đei mơjĭt tŏ ake, tơpơh tŏ kơ̆l. Sư đei mơjĭt tŏ môk pơtao tơ ake sư. Tơ rim kơ̆l sư đei chih tơdrong pơma blông kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Now the beast which I saw was like a leopard, his feet were like the feet of a bear, and his mouth like the mouth of a lion. The dragon gave him his power, his throne, and great authority.
Bahnar: Sem ei lăng hơbŏ sư thoi kla djrang, jơ̆ng sư thoi jơ̆ng chơgơu. 'Bơ̆r sư thoi 'bơ̆r dăm-brang. Na yă-grai ei pơm ăn kơ sem noh jing pran kơtang păng ăn kơ sem noh oei tơ tang-dŏ sư, pơm 'bok pơgơ̆r jơ̆p-jang kơ teh đak.

English: And I saw one of his heads as if it had been mortally wounded, and his deadly wound was healed. And all the world marveled and followed the beast.
Bahnar: Dôm lu kơ̆l sư noh, đei minh pôm kơ̆l lăng sư đei rơka să rŏ kơ đêl lôch, mă-lei tơdrong jĭ sư noh dang ei klaih 'lơ̆ng boih. Na đĭ-đăng kon bơngai jơ̆p kơ teh đak lăng sư hlĭch tơpă ưh kơ băt thoi yơ na kiơ̆ hloi sem noh.

English: So they worshiped the dragon who gave authority to the beast; and they worshiped the beast, saying, “Who is like the beast? Who is able to make war with him?”
Bahnar: Na kon bơngai đei mơ'nah kơkuh kơ yă-grai ei, yua kơ yă-grai ei pơjao kơ sem ei gơh pơgơ̆r. Lu sư kư̆m kơkuh kơ sem ei mơ̆n. Lu sư khan: “Hăm đei bu tih atŏ kơ sem âu, hăm đei bu kĕ blah sư? Ưh kơ đei ôh.”

English: And he was given a mouth speaking great things and blasphemies, and he was given authority to continue for forty-two months.
Bahnar: Na yă-grai ei ăn kơ sem 'noh pơma pơang akâu kơdih păng pơma blông kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei. Sư gơh pơgơ̆r kơplah puăn-jĭt 'bar khei đĕch.

English: Then he opened his mouth in blasphemy against God, to blaspheme His name, His tabernacle, and those who dwell in heaven.
Bahnar: Sư pơma blông kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei păng anăn 'Bok Kei-Dei mơ̆n păng sư pơma kơnê̆ kơ anih 'Bok Kei-Dei oei, hăm lu bơngai mă oei tơ plĕnh ti.

English: It was granted to him to make war with the saints and to overcome them. And authority was given him over every tribe, tongue, and nation.
Bahnar: Sư năm blah lu kon 'Bok Kei-Dei na jei sư tơpă. Na sư pơgơ̆r iŏk rim kơ adrĕch adrung kon bơngai, rim kơ dêh char, rim kơ teh đak, rim kơ nơ̆r pơma kon bơngai. Mă tơdrong noh yua kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ pơgăn đĕch na sư gơh.

English: All who dwell on the earth will worship him, whose names have not been written in the Book of Life of the Lamb slain from the foundation of the world.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng bơngai jơ̆p kơ teh đak gô kơkuh kơ sem ei. Pôm lu bơngai mă Kon Triu 'Bok Kei-Dei chih anăn lu sư tơ hla bơar Sư đĕch, ưh kơ chu kơkuh kơ sem ei. Kon Triu noh boih lôch tang kon bơngai. Na tơdrong Sư chih anăn lu bơngai mă Sư ăn arih, Sư chih adrol kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei pơjing plĕnh teh sơ̆ hloi boih.

English: If anyone has an ear, let him hear.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu đei đon, mơ̆ng mă nhên bĕ dôm tơdrong âu

English: He who leads into captivity shall go into captivity; he who kills with the sword must be killed with the sword. Here is the patience and the faith of the saints.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu trŏ kơ đe wă tah sư tơ lăm hnam phak sư athei chu kơ đe tah đĕch. Bơngai bu trŏ kơ đe pơlôch păng đao sư athei chu lôch kơ pla đao đĕch. Iĕm băt kơ thoi noh boih, na lu bơngai mă lui athei adrin gơnang kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei đĕch.

English: Then I saw another beast coming up out of the earth, and he had two horns like a lamb and spoke like a dragon.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh inh 'bôh minh pôm sem nai dơ̆ng sư lĕch đơ̆ng teh. Sư đei 'bar pah ake, thoi ake triu. Nơ̆r sư pơma lei-lăi thoi yă-grai pơma.

English: And he exercises all the authority of the first beast in his presence, and causes the earth and those who dwell in it to worship the first beast, whose deadly wound was healed.
Bahnar: Sư gơh pơm tôm tơdrong thoi sem mă mônh kiơ̆ kơ sem mă mônh ăn. Na sư chă pơgŏ đĭ-đăng kơ kon pơlei pơla mă oei tơ teh athei kơkuh kơ sem mă mônh, sem mă đêl rơka kơ đe 'bet mă klaih boih.
