English: He performs great signs, so that he even makes fire come down from heaven on the earth in the sight of men.
Bahnar: Sư gơh pơm lơ tơdrong hlĭch, sư pơm ŭnh đơ̆ng plĕnh huŏng tơ teh 'bơ̆t anăp đe kư̆m gơh mơ̆n.

English: And he deceives those who dwell on the earth by those signs which he was granted to do in the sight of the beast, telling those who dwell on the earth to make an image to the beast who was wounded by the sword and lived.
Bahnar: Sem ei pơm tơ'bôh kơ đe tơdrong hlĭch kiơ̆ sem mă mônh ăn, thoi noh na sư pơhlŭ lu kon pơlei pơla oei tơ ala teh âu pơm minh pôm rup sem mă mônh, sem mă đei rơka đêl đe 'bet mă oei arih.

English: He was granted power to give breath to the image of the beast, that the image of the beast should both speak and cause as many as would not worship the image of the beast to be killed.
Bahnar: Sem ei gơh pơm kơ rup sem mă đêl đe pơm ei gơh dui jơhngơ̆m păng gơh pơma athei đe pơlôch tŭk dôm lu bơngai mă ưh kơ chu kơkuh kơ sư.

English: He causes all, both small and great, rich and poor, free and slave, to receive a mark on their right hand or on their foreheads
Bahnar: Păng sem ei pơgŏ đĭ-đăng măt bơngai 'lơ̆p 'lŏ, nge kră, pơm tih, pơm iĕ, mă mơdrŏng, mă dơnuh, mă rơngei, mă đĭch đe, sư pơgŏ athei chơ̆m đŏng yâu sư 'bơ̆t tơpang ti 'ma dah 'bơ̆t klĕng.

English: and that no one may buy or sell except one who has the mark or the name of the beast, or the number of his name.
Bahnar: Tơ̆ng bu ưh kơ chu chơ̆m đŏng yâu sư noh, bơngai noh sư ưh kơ ăn mơdro sa păng ưh kơ ăn chă năm răt tơmam. Đŏng yâu noh đe chih anăn sem mă mônh, phŏ chih pôm kơsô̆ mă trŏ kơ anăn sem mă mônh noh mơ̆n.

English: Here is wisdom. Let him who has understanding calculate the number of the beast, for it is the number of a man: His number is 666.
Bahnar: Na bu mă hơgei, apinh sư tinh jô̆ lăng kơsô̆ noh, wă kơ băt anăn sem noh anăn sư kiơ. Yua kơ kơsô̆ ei đe khan trŏ kơ anăn kon bơngai. Đŏng yâu noh sư chih kơsô̆ tơdrâu-hrĕng tơdrâu-jĭt tơdrâu.

English: Then I looked, and behold, a Lamb standing on Mount Zion, and with Him one hundred and forty-four thousand, having His Father’s name written on their foreheads.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh inh hue lăng inh 'bôh Kon Triu dơ̆ng tơ kơpal kông Siôn, Sư dơ̆ng hơdai păng lu đe minh-hrĕng puăn-jĭt puăn-rơbâu 'nu lu bơngai mă đei chơ̆m đŏng yâu Kon Triu păng đŏng yâu 'Bă Kon Triu tơ klĕng lu sư kơdih kơdih.

English: And I heard a voice from heaven, like the voice of many waters, and like the voice of loud thunder. And I heard the sound of harpists playing their harps.
Bahnar: Inh đei kơtơ̆ng dơ̆ng 'bơ̆r pơma jơwa đơ̆ng plĕnh thoi lĕ kơ jơwa đak chơkơi păng thoi jơwa grơ̆m glaih, jơwa noh thoi jơwa bơngai tơpôl reh brŏ kư̆m đei.

English: They sang as it were a new song before the throne, before the four living creatures, and the elders; and no one could learn that song except the hundred and forty-four thousand who were redeemed from the earth.
Bahnar: Lu sư hơri minh tơdrong 'nao 'bơ̆t anăp tang-dŏ 'Bok Kei-Dei, 'bơ̆t anăp puăn anăn păng 'bơ̆t anăp lu đe kră. Pôm lu minh-hrĕng puăn-jĭt puăn-rơbâu 'nu noh đĕch gơh hơri tơdrong 'nao ei, lu nai ưh kơ đei bu gơh ôh, yua kơ lu bơngai noh 'Bok Kei-Dei huai iŏk lu sư đơ̆ng khŭl bơngai ala teh âu boih.

English: These are the ones who were not defiled with women, for they are virgins. These are the ones who follow the Lamb wherever He goes. These were redeemed from among men, being firstfruits to God and to the Lamb.
Bahnar: Lu sư bơngai rơgoh 'lơ̆ng ngăl ưh kơ đei kiơ̆ lu bơngai ưh kơ lui pơm yoch ôh. Lu sư thoi bơngai drŏ-nglo mă ưh kơ pơ̆n ngôi jê̆ bơngai drŏ-kăn, thoi bơngai drŏ-kăn mă ưh kơ pơ̆n ngôi jê̆ hăm bơngai drŏ-nglo. Kon Triu 'Bok Kei-Dei năm tơ yơ lu sư kiơ̆ tơ noh, yua kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei huai iŏk lu sư đơ̆ng khŭl kon bơngai, na lu sư dang tơmam đe pơyơ̆r ăn kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei păng pơyơ̆r ăn kơ Kon Triu.

English: And in their mouth was found no deceit, for they are without fault before the throne of God.
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei 'bôh lu sư ling-lang pơma 'lơ̆ng ưh kơ đei pơma hơlĕnh hơya tŏ sĕt, yua kơ lu sư jing bơngai rơgoh 'lơ̆ng boih.

English: Then I saw another angel flying in the midst of heaven, having the everlasting gospel to preach to those who dwell on the earth—to every nation, tribe, tongue, and people
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh inh 'bôh linh jang 'lơ̆ng nai dơ̆ng, sư păr asơ̆ng tŏk-bŏk rơwơ̆ng, ră roi kơ đe tơdrong 'nao 'lơ̆ng wă kơ đe gơh arih ling-lang. Sư ră roi tơdrong noh kơ đĭ-đăng bơngai rim kơ dêh char, rim kơ teh đak, rim kơ adrĕch adrung, rim kơ nơ̆r pơma kon bơngai.

English: saying with a loud voice, “Fear God and give glory to Him, for the hour of His judgment has come; and worship Him who made heaven and earth, the sea and springs of water.”
Bahnar: Na sư pơma 'bơ̆r re kơ đe wă kơ đe kơtơ̆ng, sư khan thoi âu: “Iĕm athei băt hli kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei păng ư-ang kơ Sư, yua kơ Sư wă sek tơlang iĕm boih. Kơkuh kơ Sư bĕ, yua kơ Sư Yang pơjing plĕnh teh, pơjing đak dơsĭ, pơjing tôm kơ tu đak.”

English: And another angel followed, saying, “Babylon is fallen, is fallen, that great city, because she has made all nations drink of the wine of the wrath of her fornication.”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh đei linh jang 'lơ̆ng nai mă 'bar kiơ̆ đơ̆ng rŏng sư khan: “Pơlei Babilôn tih krưp tŏ noh ră, mă-lei pơchah pơchek đĭ boih, yua kơ tơdrong yoch lu sư pơm tơ'bôh kơ đe jơ̆p kơ teh đak.”

English: Then a third angel followed them, saying with a loud voice, “If anyone worships the beast and his image, and receives his mark on his forehead or on his hand
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh đei linh jang 'lơ̆ng nai dơ̆ng kiơ̆ đơ̆ng rŏng sư pơma 'bơ̆r re kơ đe khan: “Bu chu kơkuh kơ sem păng rup sem noh păng chu chơ̆m đŏng yâu sem noh tơ klĕng dah tơ ti sư

English: he himself shall also drink of the wine of the wrath of God, which is poured out full strength into the cup of His indignation. He shall be tormented with fire and brimstone in the presence of the holy angels and in the presence of the Lamb.
Bahnar: bơngai noh 'Bok Kei-Dei hil areh tơpă, dang ăn kơ sư et sik hrăp, sik noh 'Bok Kei-Dei tring tơ kơchŏk 'nhŭ tăng hơ̆-hang. Bơngai noh gô hăl hang oei tơ anih pơmat-tat tơ lăm dơnâu ŭnh tơbang 'bơ̆t anăp lu linh jang 'lơ̆ng păng Kon Triu.

English: And the smoke of their torment ascends forever and ever; and they have no rest day or night, who worship the beast and his image, and whoever receives the mark of his name.”
Bahnar: Na ŭnh mă pơmat lu sư noh đei 'nhui tŏk ling-lang ưh kơ đei pơdơh. Lu bơngai mă kơkuh kơ sem păng rup sem noh păng chu ăn kơ sem noh chơ̆m đŏng yâu sư, lu bơngai noh lu sư pơmat măng năr, pă đei hiôk hơya tŏ sĕt 'biơ̆.”

English: Here is the patience of the saints; here are those who keep the commandments of God and the faith of Jesus.
Bahnar: Yua kơ thoi noh boih na lu bơ̆n bơngai lui kơ Yêsu păng kiơ̆ tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei pơkă, bơ̆n athei adrin lui khŏm khŏm 'nĕ kơ achăng lê̆ Sư, mă đe pơmat bơ̆n dang yơ.

English: Then I heard a voice from heaven saying to me, “Write: ‘Blessed are the dead who die in the Lord from now on.’ ” “Yes,” says the Spirit, “that they may rest from their labors, and their works follow them.”
Bahnar: Păng inh kơtơ̆ng dơ̆ng nơ̆r pơma đơ̆ng plĕnh Sư khan kơ inh thoi âu: “Inh wă kơ ih chih tơdrong âu: Lu bơngai mă lui boih kơ Kră Yang mă sư lôch kơnh pơgê dah layơ sư hiôk boih.” Na Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng tơl Sư: “Tơpă gô hiôk thoi Sư khan, yua kơ lu sư dang pơdơh kơ tơdrong jang pơmat-tat tơ ala teh âu. Mă-lei mă sư jang pơmat-tat gleh glăn tơ ala teh âu dang yơ, 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m ưh kơ hiơt tơdrong sư jang hrat noh ôh.”

English: Then I looked, and behold, a white cloud, and on the cloud sat One like the Son of Man, having on His head a golden crown, and in His hand a sharp sickle.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh inh lăng dơ̆ng na 'bôh hơmơ̆l kok. Kơpal hơmơ̆l kok noh inh đei 'bôh minh 'nu hơbŏ thoi Kon Bơngai. Sư yơ̆l môk maih păng Sư chĕp săng kô han.

English: And another angel came out of the temple, crying with a loud voice to Him who sat on the cloud, “Thrust in Your sickle and reap, for the time has come for You to reap, for the harvest of the earth is ripe.”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh đei minh 'nu linh jang 'lơ̆ng nai dơ̆ng lĕch đơ̆ng hnam 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ plĕnh, sư pơma 'bơ̆r re kơ 'Bok mă oei kơpal hơmơ̆l thoi âu: “Dang ei mir 'ba tơ ala teh sŭng truh bơyan sư đum boih, iŏk săng kô Ih yuă bĕ.”

English: So He who sat on the cloud thrust in His sickle on the earth, and the earth was reaped.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na 'Bok mă oei kơpal hơmơ̆l noh Sư năm yuă iŏk pơđĭ lu 'ba noh.

English: Then another angel came out of the temple which is in heaven, he also having a sharp sickle.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh đei minh 'nu linh jang 'lơ̆ng nai lĕch đơ̆ng hnam 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ plĕnh mơ̆n, sư kư̆m đei săng kô han.

English: And another angel came out from the altar, who had power over fire, and he cried with a loud cry to him who had the sharp sickle, saying, “Thrust in your sharp sickle and gather the clusters of the vine of the earth, for her grapes are fully ripe.”
Bahnar: Đei dơ̆ng minh 'nu linh jang 'lơ̆ng nai, sư lĕch đơ̆ng anih chơnang soi. Sư wei-lăng ŭnh tơ anih chơnang soi. Na sư pơma 'bơ̆r re kơ buăl sư mă đei chĕp săng kô han noh thoi âu: “Săng kô ih noh, ih năm kăt pơđĭ lu hơie plei hơmu lăm war tơ ala teh sŭng, yua kơ plei hơmu noh kư̆m truh bơyan sư đum boih.”

English: So the angel thrust his sickle into the earth and gathered the vine of the earth, and threw it into the great winepress of the wrath of God.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na linh jang 'lơ̆ng mă đei săng kô han noh sư hơloh năm kăt pơđĭ lu hơie plei hơmu đơ̆ng lăm war tơ ala teh noh tah tơ lăm tơpăl tơmo mă đe juăt kơ peh chơpĕt iŏk đak sư. Tơdrong 'nâu ưh kơ pơma gah plei hơmu tơpă ôh, sư pơtih gia kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei hil kơ lu bơngai ala teh ưh kơ lui, na Sư gô pơrăm lu bơngai ưh kơ lui noh thoi đe peh pơhĕch plei hơmu.

English: And the winepress was trampled outside the city, and blood came out of the winepress, up to the horses’ bridles, for one thousand six hundred furlongs.
Bahnar: Anih đe peh plei hơmu noh tơ 'ngoaih pơlei. Pham ro đơ̆ng tơpăl tơmo noh ataih dang pêng-hrĕng kơsô̆, jrŭ pham noh lơ̆p ako aseh.

English: Then I saw another sign in heaven, great and marvelous: seven angels having the seven last plagues, for in them the wrath of God is complete.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh inh đei 'bôh tơdrong tơ kơpal plĕnh ti hlĭch dêh. Đei tơpơh 'nu linh jang 'lơ̆ng, lu sư wă iŏk tơpơh pơnhan đak pơgang wă pơmat lu bơngai ưh kơ lui. Tơpơh pơnhan đak pơgang noh gô đei tơpơh 'măng pơmat. Tơpơh 'măng đei tơdrong pơmat noh 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn pơmat pơhrăp kon bơngai lu mă Sư hil. Klaih kơ noh Sư huay pă hil dơ̆ng boih.

English: And I saw something like a sea of glass mingled with fire, and those who have the victory over the beast, over his image and over his mark and over the number of his name, standing on the sea of glass, having harps of God.
Bahnar: Inh kư̆m 'bôh tơdrong hlĭch thoi đak dơsĭ hlăng chơchơr thoi getchai thoi amĭl, mă kư̆m lăng thoi đei ŭnh mơ̆n. Na lu bơngai mă ưh kơ chu kơkuh kơ rup sem, akâu sem ei păng ưh kơ ăn sem ei chơ̆m đŏng yâu tơ klĕng sư păng kuă kơ iŏk dôm tơmam sem ei, kơsô̆ sư dah anăn sư, jei lu bơngai noh boih. Na đĭ-đăng lu bơngai noh lu sư dơ̆ng kơpal đak dơsĭ ei. Lu sư iŏk brŏ 'Bok Kei-Dei

English: They sing the song of Moses, the servant of God, and the song of the Lamb, saying: “Great and marvelous are Your works, Lord God Almighty! Just and true are Your ways, O King of the saints!
Bahnar: hơri tơdrong Môis đam 'Bok Kei-Dei sư bơnê kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn jei sư sơ̆; păng hơri tơdrong Kon Triu mơ̆n. Tơdrong lu sư hơri ei thoi âu: “Ơ 'Bok Kei-Dei Kră Yang Tih Hloh, tôm tơdrong Ih pơm mơsêh mơyang tih-tin ngăl. Ơ 'Bok Pơtao mă pơgơ̆r ling-lang, tôm tơdrong Ih pơm tă ling tơpăt ngăl.

English: Who shall not fear You, O Lord, and glorify Your name? For You alone are holy. For all nations shall come and worship before You, For Your judgments have been manifested.”
Bahnar: Ơ Kră Yang, đĭ-đăng bơngai băt hli kơ Ih, păng ư-ang anăn Ih, yua kơ pôm Ih đĕch pơm 'lơ̆ng tơpăt. Đĭ rim khŭl bơngai băt năm kơkuh 'bơ̆t anăp Ih, yua kơ Ih sek tơlang tơpăt ngăl.”

English: After these things I looked, and behold, the temple of the tabernacle of the testimony in heaven was opened.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh inh lăng dơ̆ng tơ kơpal plĕnh na 'bôh hnam 'Bok Kei-Dei oei thoi hnam akŭm lu bơngai Isơrael pơm păng tua-la-tăng tơ dêh char glă sơ̆, hnam ei 'măng tơpơih.

English: And out of the temple came the seven angels having the seven plagues, clothed in pure bright linen, and having their chests girded with golden bands.
Bahnar: Na tơpơh 'nu lu linh jang mă wă iŏk tơpơh pơnhan đak pơgang wă pơmat đe ei, lu sư lĕch đơ̆ng hnam 'Bok Kei-Dei noh tă hrŭk ao tai kok rơgoh ngăl păng chô̆ gơ'năm maih tơ kơtơh lu sư.

English: Then one of the four living creatures gave to the seven angels seven golden bowls full of the wrath of God who lives forever and ever.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh đei minh 'nu lăm puăn anăn sem brem mă ư-ang anăn 'Bok Kei-Dei, sư iŏk ăn kơ tơpơh 'nu lu linh jang 'lơ̆ng tơpơh tŏ pơnhan 'bĕnh kơ tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei mă arih ling-lang hil areh kơ kon bơngai, Sư wă phak pơhrăp tơdrong Sư hil areh noh.

English: The temple was filled with smoke from the glory of God and from His power, and no one was able to enter the temple till the seven plagues of the seven angels were completed.
Bahnar: Kơplah lu linh jang 'lơ̆ng tuh đak pơgang đơ̆ng pơnhan lu sư ei tơ teh, tơ lăm hnam 'Bok Kei-Dei 'bĕnh-'bang kơ 'nhui. 'Nhui noh wă tơbăt ăn kơ kon bơngai, mơsêh 'Bok Kei-Dei pơm ưh kơ đei bu gơh mơ̆t, mă đơ̆ng năr lu sư iŏk tơpơh tŏ pơnhan ei truh tuh đĭ.

English: Then I heard a loud voice from the temple saying to the seven angels, “Go and pour out the bowls of the wrath of God on the earth.”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh inh kơtơ̆ng 'bơ̆r pơma re đơ̆ng lăm hnam 'Bok Kei-Dei ei khan kơ tơpơh 'nu lu linh jang 'lơ̆ng wă tuh đak pơgang ei thoi âu: “Năm bĕ, tuh tơpơh tŏ pơnhan đak pơgang tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei hil tơ teh.”

English: So the first went and poured out his bowl upon the earth, and a foul and loathsome sore came upon the men who had the mark of the beast and those who worshiped his image.
Bahnar: Thoi noh na linh jang 'lơ̆ng mă mônh năm tuh hloi đak pơgang noh tơ teh. Na dôm lu bơngai mă chơ̆m đŏng yâu sem ei, kơkuh kơ rup sem ei, lu sư đei tơdrong jĭ tơ'boch đuh 'mê̆-'mach dêh.

English: Then the second angel poured out his bowl on the sea, and it became blood as of a dead man; and every living creature in the sea died.
Bahnar: Linh jang 'lơ̆ng mă 'bar tuh đak pơgang sư tơ đak dơsĭ, na đak dơsĭ jing pham thoi pham kon bơngai lôch. Na dôm sem brem arih lăm đak dơsĭ lôch đĭ.

English: Then the third angel poured out his bowl on the rivers and springs of water, and they became blood.
Bahnar: Linh jang 'lơ̆ng mă pêng tuh đak pơgang sư tơ dôm lu tu đak, đak krong, đak glung, thong đak tih iĕ, na đĭ dôm lu đak noh kư̆m jing pham ngăl.

English: And I heard the angel of the waters saying: “You are righteous, O Lord, The One who is and who was and who is to be, Because You have judged these things.
Bahnar: Na inh kơtơ̆ng linh jang 'lơ̆ng mă wei-lăng dôm lu thong đak tih iĕ noh sư khan thoi âu: “Ơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, Ih đei đơ̆ng sơ̆ khơ̆ dang ei, pôm Ih đĕch pơm 'lơ̆ng tơpăt. Ih phak kon bơngai thoi noh trŏ tơpă

English: For they have shed the blood of saints and prophets, And You have given them blood to drink. For it is their just due.”
Bahnar: yua kơ lu sư pơlôch tuh pham lu kon Ih, păng lu bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r Ih, na dang ei Ih pơkăl ăn kơ lu sư huch pham 'noh trŏ tơpă.”

English: And I heard another from the altar saying, “Even so, Lord God Almighty, true and righteous are Your judgments.”
Bahnar: Na inh kơtơ̆ng 'bơ̆r pơma đơ̆ng chơnang soi, sư khan thoi âu: “Ơ 'Bok Kei-Dei Kră Yang Tih Hloh, trŏ tơpă mă Ih phak thoi noh.”

English: Then the fourth angel poured out his bowl on the sun, and power was given to him to scorch men with fire.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh linh jang 'lơ̆ng mă puăn tuh đak pơgang sư tơ măt 'năr, pơm kơ măt 'năr tŏ phang hơnơ̆ng hơnong wă kơ tŏ sa pơmat kon bơngai.

English: And men were scorched with great heat, and they blasphemed the name of God who has power over these plagues; and they did not repent and give Him glory.
Bahnar: Tŏ sa kon bơngai na kon bơngai blei hiap pơma kơnê̆ kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei, yua kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei phak pơmat lu sư tôm tơdrong thoi noh. Mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ chu tơbral tơdrong yoch 'mơ̆i hăm ưh kơ wă ư-ang kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: Then the fifth angel poured out his bowl on the throne of the beast, and his kingdom became full of darkness; and they gnawed their tongues because of the pain.
Bahnar: Linh jang mă pơđăm tuh đak pơgang đơ̆ng pơnhan sư tơ kơpal tang-dŏ sem brem mă kơnê̆ ei, na jơ̆p kơ teh đak sem ei pơgơ̆r jing măng mu. Đĭ-đăng kon bơngai nhơ̆m hmoi tơkăp hơpiĕt kơdih kơdih yua kơ lu sư jĭ dêh trŏ hơkăm pơgang noh.

English: They blasphemed the God of heaven because of their pains and their sores, and did not repent of their deeds.
Bahnar: Lu sư pơma kơnê̆ kơ Kră Yang mă oei tơ plĕnh, yua kơ lu sư hăl hang kơ jĭ tơ'boch păng dôm tơdrong pơmat noh. Mă-lei lu sư ưh kơ chu tơbral tơdrong yoch lu sư pơm ôh.

English: Then the sixth angel poured out his bowl on the great river Euphrates, and its water was dried up, so that the way of the kings from the east might be prepared.
Bahnar: Linh jang mă tơdrâu tuh đak pơgang đơ̆ng pơnhan sư tơ krong tih mă đe anăn krong Êphrat, na krong ei jing hrơ̆ hloi jing trong hrĕng 'lơ̆ng ăn kơ lu 'bok pơtao đơ̆ng gah hơlĕch wă năm tơblah.

English: And I saw three unclean spirits like frogs coming out of the mouth of the dragon, out of the mouth of the beast, and out of the mouth of the false prophet.
Bahnar: Inh kư̆m 'bôh pêng 'nu yang kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach hơbŏ sư thoi kưt, sư lĕch đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r yă-grai, 'bơ̆r sem mă kơnê̆ păng 'bơ̆r sem mă gơh tơdrong hlĭch wă kơ kon bơngai lui kiơ̆ kơ sư.

English: For they are spirits of demons, performing signs, which go out to the kings of the earth and of the whole world, to gather them to the battle of that great day of God Almighty.
Bahnar: Pêng 'nu yang noh yang kơnê̆ ngăl, lu sư kư̆m gơh pơm tơdrong hlĭch hlăch mơ̆n. Păng lu sư năm jơ̆p kơ teh đak krao akŭm lu 'bok pơtao tơblah hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei kơplah năr 'Bok Kei-Dei hăt kơ tơblah tơblŭng hơlŭng pơdang, mơsêh tăp pang mơyang tăp dăr tôch 'bơ̆t Sư boih.

English: “Behold, I am coming as a thief. Blessed is he who watches, and keeps his garments, lest he walk naked and they see his shame.”
Bahnar: Inh 'bôh thoi noh boih na inh kơtơ̆ng Kră Yang Yêsu Krist khan: “Inh wă jur kơplah kon bơngai ưh kơ lêng ê thoi bơngai wă năm tơtông. Hiôk dêh bu mă oei kral kơchăng păng đei hơbĕn ao hrŭk wă kơ đe huay kơ 'bôh sư hang-hông.”

English: And they gathered them together to the place called in Hebrew, Armageddon.
Bahnar: Na pêng 'nu yang kơnê̆ ei krao akŭm lu 'bok pơtao tơ anih Armagedon kiơ̆ kơ nơ̆r Hêbrơ khan.

English: Then the seventh angel poured out his bowl into the air, and a loud voice came out of the temple of heaven, from the throne, saying, “It is done!”
Bahnar: Linh jang mă tơpơh tuh đak pơgang đơ̆ng pơnhan sư tơ kơpal rơwơ̆ng ti. Klaih kơ noh na inh kơtơ̆ng 'bơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei pơma re đơ̆ng tang-dŏ Sư lăm hnam khan: “Thôi, asong kon bơngai pơmat dôm noh boih.”

English: And there were noises and thunderings and lightnings; and there was a great earthquake, such a mighty and great earthquake as had not occurred since men were on the earth.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh na đei hloi grơ̆m aru 'mi pru sơaih glaih tơdrăng păng đei teh adrŏ tơtơ̆ng krưp dêh; đơ̆ng kon bơngai pơtơm oei tơ teh sơ̆ khơ̆ năr noh kơnh ưh tam kơtơ̆ng teh adrŏ krưp dang noh.

English: Now the great city was divided into three parts, and the cities of the nations fell. And great Babylon was remembered before God, to give her the cup of the wine of the fierceness of His wrath.
Bahnar: Pơlei Babilôn pơlei tih dêh đei tơdrong truh kơ lu sư hơling hơlơ̆m pêng pah kueng pơgăn. Păng jơ̆p-jang kơ teh đak kon pơlei pơla nai kư̆m pơchah răm lei-lăi. Pơlei Babilôn 'Bok Kei-Dei hil kơ lu sư ưh kơ chu, na Sư ăn kơ lu sư et sik pơhrăp tơdrong Sư hil.

English: Then every island fled away, and the mountains were not found.
Bahnar: Păng pơm kơ lu kông, lu bŏl lăm đak dơsĭ hơlŭng pơdang glach jing pă 'bôh.

English: And great hail from heaven fell upon men, each hailstone about the weight of a talent. Men blasphemed God because of the plague of the hail, since that plague was exceedingly great.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh Sư pơm 'mi pru prĕl tih huŏng đơ̆ng plĕnh kơdŭk kơdăk trăp dang pơđăm-jĭt kĭ kơtĭt kon bơngai tơ teh. Kon bơngai blei hiap 'Bok Kei-Dei, yua kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei phak păng 'mi prĕl tih krưp ei.

English: Then one of the seven angels who had the seven bowls came and talked with me, saying to me, “Come, I will show you the judgment of the great harlot who sits on many waters
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh minh 'nu lăm tơpơh 'nu linh jang mă chĕp tơpơh tŏ pơnhan ei, sư năm tơ inh păng khan: “Kiơ̆ inh bĕ, inh gô tơ'bôh kơ ih tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei phak bơngai đi pơm pơyô ngôi kư̆ kă noh, bơngai ei oei 'bơ̆t cheng đak krong hăm đak glung.

English: with whom the kings of the earth committed fornication, and the inhabitants of the earth were made drunk with the wine of her fornication.”
Bahnar: Lu 'bok pơtao jơ̆p kơ teh đak kư̆m ngôi pơyô hăm sư mơ̆n, sư boih pơm pơyô kư̆ kă tơ'bôh kơ đe jơ̆p kơ teh đak adrol, dang sư ăn kơ đe et sik suai.”

English: So he carried me away in the Spirit into the wilderness. And I saw a woman sitting on a scarlet beast which was full of names of blasphemy, having seven heads and ten horns.
Bahnar: Linh jang ei pơma đang boih, klaih kơ noh inh ưh kơ băt thoi yơ Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng ăn kơ linh jang pôk anhăk ba inh tơ bri chơngue. Na inh 'bôh bơngai drŏ-kăn ei hao kơpal sem 'brê. Tơ akâu sem ei đe chih 'bĕnh-'bang lơ tơdrong pơma blông kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei ngăl. Sem 'brê ei đei tơpơh tŏ kơ̆l, mơjĭt tŏ ake.

English: The woman was arrayed in purple and scarlet, and adorned with gold and precious stones and pearls, having in her hand a golden cup full of abominations and the filthiness of her fornication.
Bahnar: Bơngai drŏ-kăn ei hrŭk ao tai 'brê 'lơ̆ng, 'băk kong kiơng maih, đoh sơle rang gơhlâu, ti sư chĕp pơnhan maih 'bĕnh kơ tơdrong 'mê̆-'mach păng tơdrong sư pơm kư̆ kă.

English: And on her forehead a name was written: MYSTERY, BABYLON THE GREAT, THE MOTHER OF HARLOTS AND OF THE ABOMINATIONS OF THE EARTH.
Bahnar: Klĕng bơngai drŏ-kăn noh đe chih anăn sư, mă đe chih tơwer hrĕp. Đe chih thoi âu: “Pơlei Babilôn pơlei tih dêh mĕ kơ lu drŏ-kăn đi, tơ'bôh kơ đe tơdrong 'mê̆ jơ̆p kơ teh đak.”

English: I saw the woman, drunk with the blood of the saints and with the blood of the martyrs of Jesus. And when I saw her, I marveled with great amazement.
Bahnar: Păng inh 'bôh sư suai kơ pham lu bơngai lui, lu bơngai năm ră roi tơdrong Kră Yang Yêsu. Inh 'bôh bơngai drŏ-kăn noh inh sơleng kơ đon, ưh kơ hlôh tơdrong kiơ.

English: But the angel said to me, “Why did you marvel? I will tell you the mystery of the woman and of the beast that carries her, which has the seven heads and the ten horns.
Bahnar: Na linh jang 'lơ̆ng ei khan kơ inh: “Yua kơ kiơ ih ưh kơ hlôh? Lê̆ inh tơblang ăn kơ ih tơdrong hrĕp bơngai drŏ-kăn noh păng tơdrong sem mă đei tơpơh tŏ kơ̆l, mơjĭt tŏ ake, mă bơngai drŏ-kăn noh hao.

English: The beast that you saw was, and is not, and will ascend out of the bottomless pit and go to perdition. And those who dwell on the earth will marvel, whose names are not written in the Book of Life from the foundation of the world, when they see the beast that was, and is not, and yet is.
Bahnar: Sem mă ih 'bôh noh hei, sơ̆ sư arih hiôk, mă dang ei sư lôch ưh pă 'bôh boih. Ning-mônh sư arih mơ̆n, mă ưh pă arih hiôk boih, yua kơ ning-mônh sư tŏk đơ̆ng sơlŭng jrŭ năm tơ anih 'Bok Kei-Dei phak pơrăm. Pôm lu bơngai mă Kră Yang Yêsu ưh kơ đei chih anăn sư lăm hla bơar tơdrong arih đĕch ư-ang kơ sư. Dôm lu bơngai lui tơpă Sư chih anăn sư lăm noh đơ̆ng blŭng-a pơjing plĕnh teh sơ̆. Lu bơngai ưh kơ lui ư-ang kơ sem noh yua kơ sơ̆ sư arih hiôk, dang ei lôch ưh pă 'bôh boih, mă-lei ning-mônh gô iung arih dơ̆ng.

English: “Here is the mind which has wisdom: The seven heads are seven mountains on which the woman sits.
Bahnar: “Na tơdrong âu iĕm athei tơchĕng mă nhên: Tơpơh tŏ kơ̆l noh wă khan, tơpơh tŏ dơng groi cham char bơngai đi oei.

English: There are also seven kings. Five have fallen, one is, and the other has not yet come. And when he comes, he must continue a short time.
Bahnar: Tơpơh tŏ kơ̆l noh kư̆m wă pơtih gia kơ tơpơh 'nu 'bok pơtao. Tơpơh 'nu 'bok pơtao noh pơđăm 'nu lôch boih, minh 'nu mă oei pơgơ̆r dang ei, minh 'nu tam mă trŏ kơ sư pơgơ̆r. Mă sư pơgơ̆r, sư pơgơ̆r ưh kơ đunh ôh.

English: The beast that was, and is not, is himself also the eighth, and is of the seven, and is going to perdition.
Bahnar: Gah sem brem mă sơ̆ arih hiôk, dang ei lôch ưh pă 'bôh boih noh, sư pơm pơtao mă tơhngam, sư păl lu tơpơh 'nu noh, ning-mônh 'Bok Kei-Dei gô phak sư kơtang kơtĭt.

English: “The ten horns which you saw are ten kings who have received no kingdom as yet, but they receive authority for one hour as kings with the beast.
Bahnar: “Mơjĭt tŏ ake sư noh wă pơtih gia kơ mơjĭt 'nu pơtao đơ̆ng rŏng wă pơgơ̆r hơdai hăm sư; mă lu sư pơgơ̆r ưh kơ đunh ôh dang kơ minh jơ đĕch.

English: These are of one mind, and they will give their power and authority to the beast.
Bahnar: Đĭ dôm lu sư pôm đon pơjao ăn kơ sem brem mă lôch iung arih noh pơgơ̆r.

English: These will make war with the Lamb, and the Lamb will overcome them, for He is Lord of lords and King of kings; and those who are with Him are called, chosen, and faithful.”
Bahnar: Đĭ lu sư iung blah Kon Triu, Kon Triu iung blah lu sư jei hloi Kon Triu, yua kơ Kon Triu Sư pơm Yŏng, Sư Yŏng kơ đĭ-đăng lu bơngai pơm yŏng; Sư pơm 'Bok Pơtao, Sư tih hloh kơ đĭ-đăng lu pơtao nai. Na dôm lu bơngai mă kiơ̆ Kon Triu, lu bơngai noh đơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei rơih iŏk ngăl boih. Lu bơngai noh kiơ̆ tơpă ưh kơ wă achăng lê̆ Sư ôh.”

English: Then he said to me, “The waters which you saw, where the harlot sits, are peoples, multitudes, nations, and tongues.
Bahnar: Na linh jang hei khan kơ inh dơ̆ng thoi âu: “Glung đak mă ih 'bôh bơngai drŏ-kăn oei hei noh, 'noh wă pơtih gia kơ tôm kơ adrĕch adrung khŭl kon bơngai lăm teh đak mă sư pơgơ̆r.

English: And the ten horns which you saw on the beast, these will hate the harlot, make her desolate and naked, eat her flesh and burn her with fire.
Bahnar: Mơjĭt tŏ ake mă ih 'bôh 'noh hei păng sem brem noh, lu sư hil areh kơ bơngai đi, na thu iŏk đĭ mŭk tơmam bơngai drŏ-kăn noh, jing akâu hoh, klaih kơ noh 'bet sa sư, 'buh pơkhoy tơ ŭnh.

English: For God has put it into their hearts to fulfill His purpose, to be of one mind, and to give their kingdom to the beast, until the words of God are fulfilled.
Bahnar: Tơdrong lu sư blah bơngai drŏ-kăn noh 'Bok Kei-Dei lăp đon mơ̆n, yua kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ lu sư pơm pôm đon thoi noh, na lu sư pơjao ăn kơ sem mă kơnê̆ noh pơgơ̆r gô mơ̆ng kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei wă dang yơ.

English: And the woman whom you saw is that great city which reigns over the kings of the earth.”
Bahnar: Bơngai drŏ-kăn mă ih 'bôh noh, wă pơtih gia kơ minh pôm pơlei tih pơgơ̆r jơ̆p kơ teh đak, đĭ-đăng lu 'bok pơtao.”

English: After these things I saw another angel coming down from heaven, having great authority, and the earth was illuminated with his glory.
Bahnar: Klaih kơ noh inh 'bôh minh 'nu linh jang nai jur đơ̆ng plĕnh pran kơtang 'lơ̆ng klă klang rang jơ̆p teh.

English: And he cried mightily with a loud voice, saying, “Babylon the great is fallen, is fallen, and has become a dwelling place of demons, a prison for every foul spirit, and a cage for every unclean and hated bird!
Bahnar: Sư pơma 'bơ̆r re kơ đe thoi âu: “Pơlei Babilôn, pơlei tih dêh, pơchah răm boih, ăn ngôi kơ yang sơmăt mă đe anăn yang kơnê̆ oei, păng đĭ lu sem brem sem păr pơm tơpu oei hơdai lăm noh 'mê̆-'mach dêh.

English: For all the nations have drunk of the wine of the wrath of her fornication, the kings of the earth have committed fornication with her, and the merchants of the earth have become rich through the abundance of her luxury.”
Bahnar: Pơlei Babilôn, pơlei pơchah răm, yua kơ tơdrong yoch lu sư pơm tơ'bôh kơ đe jơ̆p kơ teh đak, pơm pơyô kư̆ kă; lu 'bok pơtao jơ̆p teh đak kư̆m pơm pơyô hăm sư mơ̆n. Lu bơngai mơdro sa ala teh mơdrŏng yua sư, kơlih kơ tĕch kơ sư mŭk tơmam lơ tơpă.”

English: And I heard another voice from heaven saying, “Come out of her, my people, lest you share in her sins, and lest you receive of her plagues.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh inh kơtơ̆ng 'bơ̆r nai sư kư̆m pơma đơ̆ng plĕnh thoi âu: “Ơ lu kon Inh, iĕm jah lĕch jăk tơ nai hli kơ iĕm hơdai yoch thoi sư, kơnh pŭ tơdrong gleh pơmat thoi sư noh.

English: For her sins have reached to heaven, and God has remembered her iniquities.
Bahnar: Yua kơ tơdrong yoch pơlei noh tih wă atŏ kơ plĕnh. Mă-lei 'Bok Kei-Dei ưh kơ hiơt ôh dôm tơdrong kơnê̆ pơlei sư pơm.

English: Render to her just as she rendered to you, and repay her double according to her works; in the cup which she has mixed, mix double for her.
Bahnar: Mă sư pơm kơnê̆ dang yơ, gô pơm 'mong kơ sư phak sư dang noh, athei pơm tơwih kơ sư 'bar wơ̆t hloh. Sư pơgŏ iĕm et sik kơnê̆, minh tuh 'mong kơ sư, thim 'bar pơnhan hloh kơ sư tuh kơ iĕm.

English: In the measure that she glorified herself and lived luxuriously, in the same measure give her torment and sorrow; for she says in her heart, ‘I sit as queen, and am no widow, and will not see sorrow.’
Bahnar: Sư pơma pơang akâu dang yơ, hưch hanh kơ mŭk tơmam 'lơ̆ng rŏ dang yơ, sư gô pŭ tơdrong pơmat, tơdrong ơh sơ'ngon kư̆m dang noh. Sư tơchĕng lăm to sư khan: ‘Inh pơm yă pơtao pơgơ̆r đe ling-lang, Inh ưh kơ sĭ yă adro, na liơ inh gơh ơh sơ'ngon?’

English: Therefore her plagues will come in one day—death and mourning and famine. And she will be utterly burned with fire, for strong is the Lord God who judges her.
Bahnar: Yua kơ sư khan thoi noh na lăm minh năr hloi dôm tơdrong pơmat truh hloi kơ sư, tơdrong lôch, tơdrong nhơ̆m hmoi, tơdrong pơngot rơwĕt, tơdrong truh ŭnh sa pơlei pơla sư. 'Bok Kei-Dei Yang tih tên grên gô phak thoi noh tơpă.”

English: “The kings of the earth who committed fornication and lived luxuriously with her will weep and lament for her, when they see the smoke of her burning
Bahnar: Na lu 'bok pơtao jơ̆p kơ teh đak mă juăt kơ ngôi kư̆ kă hăm sư, kư̆m hơdai hưch kơ mŭk tơmam thoi sư mơ̆n, na lăp lu sư 'bôh 'nhui ŭnh sa pơlei ei, lu sư nhơ̆m hmoi.

English: standing at a distance for fear of her torment, saying, ‘Alas, alas, that great city Babylon, that mighty city! For in one hour your judgment has come.’
Bahnar: Lu sư dơ̆ng ataih kơ Pơlei Babilôn ei hli kơ trŏ tơdrong răm thoi pơlei noh. Na lu sư khan: “Ô glăi, ô glăi, Pơlei Babilôn tih-tin 'lơ̆ng rŏ, mă-lei 'Bok Kei-Dei phak blah pơchah kơbĭ dôm yơ.”

English: “And the merchants of the earth will weep and mourn over her, for no one buys their merchandise anymore
Bahnar: Păng lu bơngai mơdro sa jơ̆p-jang kơ teh đak nhơ̆m hmoi yua kơ tơdrong truh kơ Pơlei Babilôn, kơlih kơ ưh pă đei bu wă năm răt tơmam đơ̆ng lu sư tĕch

English: merchandise of gold and silver, precious stones and pearls, fine linen and purple, silk and scarlet, every kind of citron wood, every kind of object of ivory, every kind of object of most precious wood, bronze, iron, and marble
Bahnar: tôm tơdrong tơmam thoi lĕ kơ maih, hu, tơmo gĭt, găr anam, che 'bui, brai thêt, che tơpu sơdrông; păng tôm kơ kơđoh 'long 'bâu phu; tôm kơ tơmam đơ̆ng bơla rôih, 'long kơdrăk, mam kong, tôm tơdrong mam, bơ̆n tơmo rang thoi akar pơnhan

English: and cinnamon and incense, fragrant oil and frankincense, wine and oil, fine flour and wheat, cattle and sheep, horses and chariots, and bodies and souls of men.
Bahnar: bơ̆n kơđoh 'long kuê̆, bơ̆n tơmam 'bâu phu wă pơm kơ tơmam sa, bơ̆n kơđoh 'long tơ'băr đe pơm ŭnh nhang, bơ̆n gơhlâu 'bâu phu; bơ̆n sik, đak rơmă, tơpŭng đe pơm 'bĕng mi, bơ̆n 'ba sa; lu sem dơrong, thoi kơ rơmo, triu, aseh, akâu gre aseh; lu bơngai đĭch đe kư̆m đei tĕch mơ̆n, dang đe tĕch bơhngol kon bơngai.

English: The fruit that your soul longed for has gone from you, and all the things which are rich and splendid have gone from you, and you shall find them no more at all.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai juăt kơ mơdro sa khan kơ sư: “Rim kơ plei 'long lăp kơ hơlŏng 'maih sa ưh pă đei boih, dôm lu tơmam sa 'lơ̆ng 'lơ̆ng, dôm lu tơmam gĭt kăp jên, hiong đĭ ưh pă layơ wă đei dơ̆ng.”

English: The merchants of these things, who became rich by her, will stand at a distance for fear of her torment, weeping and wailing
Bahnar: Lu bơngai juăt kơ mơdro sa, lu sư juăt kơ năm mơdro tơ pơlei noh na jing mơdrŏng, lu sư tơmang lăng đơ̆ng ataih hli kơ tơdrong truh kơ lu sư păng nhơ̆m hmoi ơh ăk păk jăl

English: and saying, ‘Alas, alas, that great city that was clothed in fine linen, purple, and scarlet, and adorned with gold and precious stones and pearls!
Bahnar: chă pơma rah khan: “Ô glăi, ô glăi, Pơlei Babilôn pơlei tih-tin, rŏ kơ pơlei yă pơtao hrŭk hơbĕn ao 'brê găm jơk dreng 'lơ̆ng 'lơ̆ng, chă pơhrôp akâu kơdih 'bot bơ̆n maih, bơ̆n hu, bơ̆n anam.

English: For in one hour such great riches came to nothing.’ Every shipmaster, all who travel by ship, sailors, and as many as trade on the sea, stood at a distance
Bahnar: Lăm minh jơ đĕch ưh kơ đunh, dôm tơmam 'lơ̆ng tơmam rŏ noh hiong đĭ boih. Dôm lu kră pơgơ̆r lăm duk, lu bơngai jang lăm duk, dôm lu bơngai hao thŏng-nan năm găn đak dơsĭ chă mơdro sa, lu sư tơmang pơlei mă ŭnh sa ei đơ̆ng ataih.

English: and cried out when they saw the smoke of her burning, saying, ‘What is like this great city?’
Bahnar: Lu sư 'bôh 'nhui ŭnh sa pơlei noh na lu sư nhơ̆m hmoi ôr pơret khan: “Pă đei pơlei ayơ tih atŏ, 'lơ̆ng atŏ dang pơlei noh.”

English: “They threw dust on their heads and cried out, weeping and wailing, and saying, ‘Alas, alas, that great city, in which all who had ships on the sea became rich by her wealth! For in one hour she is made desolate.’
Bahnar: Lu sư chup teh pơnŭk săi kơpal kơ̆l lu sư mơlŭng mơlăng, nhơ̆m hmoi ơh ol pơma ôr pơret khan: “Ô glăi, ô glăi, Pơlei Babilôn pơlei tih-tin, lu bơngai đei duk oei tơ đak dơsĭ mơdrŏng yua đơ̆ng sư, lăm minh jơ đĕch ưh kơ đunh mă hiong đĭ tơmam mơdrŏng, tơmam 'lơ̆ng rŏ.”

English: “Rejoice over her, O heaven, and you holy apostles and prophets, for God has avenged you on her!”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh inh kơtơ̆ng 'bơ̆r nai dơ̆ng khan thoi âu: “Ơ lu đe mă oei tơ plĕnh, ơ lu kon 'Bok Kei-Dei, lu jơ̆ng 'bang Yêsu, lu bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei, hiôk bĕ lu iĕm yua kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei phak pơrăm boih pơlei noh mă pơm kơnê̆ kơ iĕm.”

English: Then a mighty angel took up a stone like a great millstone and threw it into the sea, saying, “Thus with violence the great city Babylon shall be thrown down, and shall not be found anymore.
Bahnar: Đei minh 'nu linh jang nai pran tih, sư iŏk minh pôm tơpăl tơmo tih tơhuŏng tơ đak dơsĭ păng khan: “Ơ Pơlei Babilôn, e hăm băt đe wă tơhuŏng e thoi inh tơhuŏng tơpăl tơmo tơ đak dơsĭ, đe ưh pă layơ wă 'bôh e dơ̆ng.

English: The sound of harpists, musicians, flutists, and trumpeters shall not be heard in you anymore. No craftsman of any craft shall be found in you anymore, and the sound of a millstone shall not be heard in you anymore.
Bahnar: Tơ tŏk-bŏk e pă layơ kơtơ̆ng tơdrong đe reh brŏ, kơtơ̆ng đe hơri suang, kơtơ̆ng đe hlôm tơgiĕp, hlôm keng; păng tôm kơ lu bơngai thơ̆, lu bơngai peh 'ba pă 'bôh boih.

English: The light of a lamp shall not shine in you anymore, and the voice of bridegroom and bride shall not be heard in you anymore. For your merchants were the great men of the earth, for by your sorcery all the nations were deceived.
Bahnar: Ŭnh kon pơlei pă 'bôh hơdah, 'bơ̆r đe hiĕk 'nă pơkong kơ bre klo kăn chă kơ mĕ 'bă ŏng mai kư̆m pă đei kơtơ̆ng. E hăm băt dôm tơdrong truh noh yua kơ lu bơngai đơ̆ng iĕm mơdro sa ưh kơ tơpăt pơm kư̆ kă hưch tơmam âu tơmam to? Jơ̆p teh đak ư-ang pơlei iĕm mơdrŏng tih. Dang ei jơ̆p teh đak pơm rok tơdrong kơnê̆ thoi iĕm.

English: And in her was found the blood of prophets and saints, and of all who were slain on the earth.”
Bahnar: “'Bok Kei-Dei phak pơlei noh yua kơ đei pham lu bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r Sư, pham lu kon Sư păng pham dôm lu bơngai mă đe pơlôch jơ̆p kơ teh đak ro lăm pơlei noh.”

English: After these things I heard a loud voice of a great multitude in heaven, saying, “Alleluia! Salvation and glory and honor and power belong to the Lord our God!
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh inh kơtơ̆ng tơ plĕnh ti thoi lĕ kơ 'bơ̆r bơngai tơpôl lơ pơma 'bơ̆r re khan: “Halêluya, ư-ang kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei dŏng pơklaih kon bơngai. Sư mơsêh mơyang tih-tin tơpă.

English: For true and righteous are His judgments, because He has judged the great harlot who corrupted the earth with her fornication; and He has avenged on her the blood of His servants shed by her.”
Bahnar: Sư sek tơlang trŏ tơpă. Sư phak boih bơngai đi mă pơm jơ̆p kơ teh đak jing kơnê̆ 'mê̆-'mach, yua kơ tơdrong sư pơm kư̆ kă păng yua kơ sư pơlôch lu đĭch đam 'Bok Kei-Dei.”

English: Again they said, “Alleluia! Her smoke rises up forever and ever!”
Bahnar: Lu bơngai tơpôl ei pơma 'bơ̆r re pă 'măng dơ̆ng: “Halêluya, ư-ang kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei yua kơ 'nhui ŭnh đơ̆ng sa Pơlei Babilôn ei tŏk khŏm khŏm hoh-hoy kơ păt.”

English: And the twenty-four elders and the four living creatures fell down and worshiped God who sat on the throne, saying, “Amen! Alleluia!”
Bahnar: Na 'bar-jĭt puăn 'nu lu đe kră, hăm puăn anăn lu kon sem brem ei lu sư 'nap 'bơ̆t anăp 'Bok Kei-Dei oei tơ tang-dŏ sư kơkuh khan: “A-men trŏ boih tơdrong iĕm khan Halêluya ư-ang kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei noh.”

English: Then a voice came from the throne, saying, “Praise our God, all you His servants and those who fear Him, both small and great!”
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh inh kơtơ̆ng 'bơ̆r pơma lĕch đơ̆ng tang-dŏ 'Bok Kei-Dei khan: “Ơ lu đĭch đam 'Bok Kei-Dei, lu bơngai lui yom kơ Sư, lu bơngai pơm tih pơm iĕ, bĕ bơ̆n kơkuh ư-ang kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei Kră Yang bơ̆n.”

English: And I heard, as it were, the voice of a great multitude, as the sound of many waters and as the sound of mighty thunderings, saying, “Alleluia! For the Lord God Omnipotent reigns!
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh inh kơtơ̆ng 'bơ̆r bơngai tơpôl pơma jơwa thoi đak chơkơi, thoi grơ̆m glaih thoi âu: “Halêluya, ư-ang kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei Kră Yang Tih Hloh. Sư wă pơgơ̆r tôm tơdrong ngăl boih.

English: Let us be glad and rejoice and give Him glory, for the marriage of the Lamb has come, and His wife has made herself ready.”
Bahnar: Bĕ bơ̆n hiôk chơt, bĕ bơ̆n 'nă hal, ư-ang anăn 'Bok Kei-Dei yua kơ trŏ năr Kon Sư Kon Triu wă iŏk akăn. Akăn Sư kư̆m hơmet tôm tơdrong đang boih.

English: And to her it was granted to be arrayed in fine linen, clean and bright, for the fine linen is the righteous acts of the saints.
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ akăn Sư hrŭk ao che 'bui kok hơdah rang dêh.” Ao che 'bui kok hơdah rang noh wă pơtih gia kơ lu kon 'Bok Kei-Dei jing bơngai 'lơ̆ng tơpăt boih.

English: Then he said to me, “Write: ‘Blessed are those who are called to the marriage supper of the Lamb!’ ” And he said to me, “These are the true sayings of God.”
Bahnar: Na linh jang khan kơ inh thoi âu: “Ih chih răk tơdrong âu hŏ: Lu bơngai mă 'Bok Kei-Dei krao sŏng sa hơpong kơ Kon Triu iŏk akăn, lu sư hiôk dêh.” Na sư khan dơ̆ng kơ inh thoi âu: “Tơdrong mă inh 'nao khan kơ ih âu hei, ưh kơ trŏ tơdrong inh kơdih ôh, tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei tơpă.”

English: And I fell at his feet to worship him. But he said to me, “See that you do not do that! I am your fellow servant, and of your brethren who have the testimony of Jesus. Worship God! For the testimony of Jesus is the spirit of prophecy.”
Bahnar: Na inh kơkuh 'nap hloi 'bơ̆t jơ̆ng sư, mă-lei sư khan: “Ih 'nĕ kơkuh kơ inh, yua kơ inh kư̆m đĭch đam 'Bok Kei-Dei thoi ih, thoi lu bôl buăl ih ră roi tơdrong Yêsu. Ih kơkuh kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei đĕch trŏ, yua kơ đĭ-đăng lu bơ̆n tă kơ ră roi tơdrong Yêsu thoi lu bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei sơ̆.”

English: Now I saw heaven opened, and behold, a white horse. And He who sat on him was called Faithful and True, and in righteousness He judges and makes war.
Bahnar: Inh kư̆m 'bôh plĕnh tơpơih păng 'bôh hloi aseh kok tơ noh. 'Bok mă oei hao aseh ei đe anăn Sư 'Bok 'Lơ̆ng Tơpăt. Tơdrong Sư sek tơlang đe kư̆m tơpăt, mă Sư blah rôp lu bơngai ayăt kơ Sư kư̆m kiơ̆ tơdrong tơpăt.

English: His eyes were like a flame of fire, and on His head were many crowns. He had a name written that no one knew except Himself.
Bahnar: Măt Sư thoi pla ŭnh, Sư yơ̆l môk pơtao lơlap. Păng đei chih anăn tơ akâu Sư, mă-lei ưh kơ đei bu băt kơ anăn Sư noh, pôm Sư kơdih đĕch băt.

English: He was clothed with a robe dipped in blood, and His name is called The Word of God.
Bahnar: Ao Sư hrŭk 'brông 'brang kơ pham ngăl. Đe anăn Sư Nơ̆r Pơma 'Bok Kei-Dei.

English: And the armies in heaven, clothed in fine linen, white and clean, followed Him on white horses.
Bahnar: Đĭ-đăng kơ linh kơpal plĕnh ti hrŭk ao kok rơgoh, tă kơ hao aseh kok kiơ̆ Sư ngăl.

English: Now out of His mouth goes a sharp sword, that with it He should strike the nations. And He Himself will rule them with a rod of iron. He Himself treads the winepress of the fierceness and wrath of Almighty God.
Bahnar: Minh hlak đao han đei 'bar pah măt lĕch đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r 'Bok ei wă koh chong drong tơ'lĕnh kon bơngai jơ̆p kơ dêh char, klaih kơ noh Sư gô pơgơ̆r đe hăm 'long jra mam. Lu bơngai mă ưh kơ lui, Sư gô phak thoi đe peh plei hơmu tơ lăm tơpăl tơmo wă chơpĕt iŏk đak, noh tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei Kră Yang Tih Hloh Sư hil kơ kon bơngai.

English: And He has on His robe and on His thigh a name written: KING OF KINGS AND LORD OF LORDS.
Bahnar: Đe chih tơ ao tai Sư mă 'bơ̆t jơ̆ng thoi âu: “Sư pơm 'Bok Pơtao, Sư tih hloh kơ đĭ-đăng lu pơtao nai. Sư pơm Yŏng, Sư tih hloh kơ đĭ-đăng lu yŏng nai.”

English: Then I saw an angel standing in the sun; and he cried with a loud voice, saying to all the birds that fly in the midst of heaven, “Come and gather together for the supper of the great God
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh inh 'bôh minh 'nu linh jang 'lơ̆ng, sư dơ̆ng tơ măt 'năr krao 'bơ̆r re lu sem păr tơ tŏk-bŏk rơwơ̆ng thoi âu: “Tơ âu bĕ akŭm băl. Pă 'biơ̆ iĕm năm et sa tih tơmam 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ iĕm.

English: that you may eat the flesh of kings, the flesh of captains, the flesh of mighty men, the flesh of horses and of those who sit on them, and the flesh of all people, free and slave, both small and great.”
Bahnar: Iĕm năm sa đak ôm atâu 'bok pơtao, 'bok tih linh, lu bơngai pran tih, lu aseh păng akâu bơngai mă hao aseh noh; sa đĭ rim khŭl bơngai rơngei, bơngai đĭch, bơngai pơm tih, pơm iĕ.”

English: And I saw the beast, the kings of the earth, and their armies, gathered together to make war against Him who sat on the horse and against His army.
Bahnar: Na inh 'bôh sem brem mă kơnê̆ ei hăm lu 'bok pơtao đơ̆ng jơ̆p kơ teh đak păng lu linh sư akŭm wă tơblah păng 'Bok mă hao aseh păng lu linh Sư mơ̆n.

English: Then the beast was captured, and with him the false prophet who worked signs in his presence, by which he deceived those who received the mark of the beast and those who worshiped his image. These two were cast alive into the lake of fire burning with brimstone.
Bahnar: Na gah sem brem mă kơnê̆ ei păng sem brem mă 'bar mă gơh pơm tơdrong hlĭch chrơp, wă kơ kon pơlei pơla lui kơ tơdrong sư pơm noh na chơ̆m đŏng yâu sem brem kơnê̆ tơ klĕng lu bơngai mă kơkuh kơ rup sư noh, gah bre sư 'Bok mă hao aseh păng lu linh Sư blah rôp tơhuŏng hloi bre sư oei arih tơ dơnâu ŭnh.

English: And the rest were killed with the sword which proceeded from the mouth of Him who sat on the horse. And all the birds were filled with their flesh.
Bahnar: Na lu linh bre sư lôch đĭ kơ 'Bok mă hao aseh koh chong drong tơ'lĕnh păng đao 'bar pah măt mă lĕch đơ̆ng 'bơ̆r Sư. Klaih kơ noh na ăn kơ lu sem păr jur sa sĕch ôm lu atâu bơngai noh hrăp hreng.

English: Then I saw an angel coming down from heaven, having the key to the bottomless pit and a great chain in his hand.
Bahnar: Inh kư̆m 'bôh minh 'nu linh jang 'lơ̆ng jur đơ̆ng plĕnh. Ti sư chĕp khuă 'măng sơlŭng jrŭ păng minh dăng tơlei glang mam tih.

English: He laid hold of the dragon, that serpent of old, who is the Devil and Satan, and bound him for a thousand years
Bahnar: Sư rôp yă-grai 'bih so sơ̆, mă đe anăn yang sơmăt, dah yang Satan. Na sư chô̆ pơkơ̆ng lăm minh-rơbâu sơnăm

English: and he cast him into the bottomless pit, and shut him up, and set a seal on him, so that he should deceive the nations no more till the thousand years were finished. But after these things he must be released for a little while.
Bahnar: na tơhuŏng sư tơ lăm sơlŭng jrŭ, tang 'măng khuă đơ̆ng kơpal păng pơklep tơdra 'măng 'noh hli kơ sư lĕch năm chă pơhlŭ đe jơ̆p kơ teh đak. Phak sư lăm sơlŭng jrŭ noh lăm minh-rơbâu sơnăm, klaih kơ noh achăng sư dơ̆ng, mă-lei ưh kơ đunh ôh.

English: And I saw thrones, and they sat on them, and judgment was committed to them. Then I saw the souls of those who had been beheaded for their witness to Jesus and for the word of God, who had not worshiped the beast or his image, and had not received his mark on their foreheads or on their hands. And they lived and reigned with Christ for a thousand years.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh inh 'bôh lơ tang-dŏ, rŏ kơ tang-dŏ 'bok pơtao. 'Bok Kei-Dei ăn kơ lu bơngai oei tơ tang-dŏ ei tă lu bơngai gơh sek tơlang kơ đe. Păng inh 'bôh bơhngol lu bơngai mă đe chơ̆ng ako sư yua kơ sư ră roi tơdrong Yêsu păng bơtho tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei, lu sư ưh kơ chu kơkuh kơ rup sem păng akâu sem mă kơnê̆ ei păng ưh kơ ăn sem ei chơ̆m đŏng yâu tơ klĕng lu sư dah tơ ti lu sư. Lu sư gô iung arih đơ̆ng lôch pơgơ̆r hơdai hăm 'Bok Krist kơplah lăm minh-rơbâu sơnăm.

English: But the rest of the dead did not live again until the thousand years were finished. This is the first resurrection.
Bahnar: Lu sư noh iung arih mă mônh adrol kơ bơngai nai. Gah lu bơngai nai, lu sư ưh kơ iung arih ôh. Dĭng tôch kơ minh-rơbâu sơnăm ei 'mơ̆i gơh.

English: Blessed and holy is he who has part in the first resurrection. Over such the second death has no power, but they shall be priests of God and of Christ, and shall reign with Him a thousand years.
Bahnar: Dôm lu bơngai mă iung arih 'măng mă mônh noh lu sư hiôk tơpă, 'Bok Kei-Dei jô̆ kơ lu sư khan lu sư bơngai 'lơ̆ng hăm Sư, huay kơ lôch truh tơ mă 'bar. Lu sư gô pơm thoi lu 'bok soi jang tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei tơdrong 'Bok Krist. Păng lu sư gô pơgơ̆r hơdai 'Bok Krist kơplah lăm minh-rơbâu sơnăm ei kơnh.

English: Now when the thousand years have expired, Satan will be released from his prison
Bahnar: Tôch minh-rơbâu sơnăm ei 'mơ̆i na achăng yang Satan lĕch đơ̆ng sơlŭng jrŭ đe chĭt sư noh.

English: and will go out to deceive the nations which are in the four corners of the earth, Gog and Magog, to gather them together to battle, whose number is as the sand of the sea.
Bahnar: Na sư gô pơhlŭ kon bơngai jơ̆p kơ teh đak, jơ̆p kơ dêh char, lu bơngai mă đe anăn Gok păng Magok. Sư krao akŭm kon bơngai jơ̆p kơ teh đak wă năm tơblah. Lu sư lơ tơpă dang pơlao chuơh dơsĭ.

English: They went up on the breadth of the earth and surrounded the camp of the saints and the beloved city. And fire came down from God out of heaven and devoured them.
Bahnar: Na lu sư nơnăm jơ̆p kơ teh đak wang tăp dăr kơ lu kon 'Bok Kei-Dei, pơlei mă 'Bok Kei-Dei 'mêm. Mă-lei đei 'Bok Kei-Dei tơgŭm lu kon Sư. 'Bok Kei-Dei tơhuŏng ŭnh đơ̆ng kơpal plĕnh soh pơlôch lu bơngai kơnê̆ noh.

English: The devil, who deceived them, was cast into the lake of fire and brimstone where the beast and the false prophet are. And they will be tormented day and night forever and ever.
Bahnar: Yang kơnê̆ Satan mă pơgơ̆r lu sư tơblah ei đe kư̆m tơlơ̆ sư tơ lăm dơnâu ŭnh. Sem brem mă kơnê̆ păng sem brem mă gơh pơm tơdrong hlĭch chrơp kư̆m tơ noh mơ̆n. Đĭ lu sư oei tơ dơnâu ŭnh hăl hang pơmat-tat măng năr ưh kơ layơ tôch.

English: Then I saw a great white throne and Him who sat on it, from whose face the earth and the heaven fled away. And there was found no place for them.
Bahnar: Inh kư̆m 'bôh minh pôm tang-dŏ tih krưp kok 'lơ̆ng păng 'bôh minh 'nu 'Bok oei kơpal tang-dŏ noh. Kơplah noh plĕnh păng teh hiong hiach đĭ, dang sư hli tơrơ kơ 'Bok noh jing ưh pă đei plĕnh păng teh tơ yơ.

English: And I saw the dead, small and great, standing before God, and books were opened. And another book was opened, which is the Book of Life. And the dead were judged according to their works, by the things which were written in the books.
Bahnar: Păng inh 'bôh lơlang lơlap kon bơngai đêl lôch iung arih; bơngai pơm tih, bơngai iĕ, đĭ lu sư dơ̆ng 'bơ̆t anăp 'Bok mă oei kơpal tang-dŏ tih krưp ei. Na 'Bok ei tak lăng lu sơ̆p hla bơar tơdrong lu bơngai lôch đêl pơm kơplah sư oei arih sơ̆. Sư kư̆m tak lăng minh sơ̆p hla bơar nai, sơ̆p hla bơar ei đe chih anăn dôm lu bơngai mă wă oei hơdai hăm 'Bok Kei-Dei ling-lang. 'Bok Kei-Dei sek tơlang lu bơngai đơ̆ng lôch, kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong lu sư đêl pơm tơ ala teh, kiơ̆ kơ đe chih 'măn lê̆ dôm tơdrong lu sư đêl pơm noh tơ lăm lu sơ̆p hla bơar ei sơ̆.

English: The sea gave up the dead who were in it, and Death and Hades delivered up the dead who were in them. And they were judged, each one according to his works.
Bahnar: 'Bơ̆t ei gô 'bôh tôm bơngai lôch. Lu bơngai lôch glơ̆k kơ đak dơsĭ, đak dơsĭ tơlĕch sư. Yŏng pơgơ̆r tơdrong lôch achăng đĭ lu bơngai lôch đơ̆ng dêh atâu. Na 'Bok Kei-Dei sek tơlang lu sư kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong lu sư đêl pơm tơ ala teh.

English: Then Death and Hades were cast into the lake of fire. This is the second death.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh dêh atâu păng yŏng pơgơ̆r tơdrong lôch kư̆m trŏ kơ tơlơ̆ sư tơ dơnâu ŭnh mơ̆n. 'Noh tơdrong lôch mă 'bar.

English: And anyone not found written in the Book of Life was cast into the lake of fire.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu ưh kơ đei anăn đe chih tơ lăm sơ̆p hla bơar tơdrong arih, bơngai noh kư̆m trŏ kơ đe tơlơ̆ sư tơ lăm dơnâu ŭnh mơ̆n.

English: Now I saw a new heaven and a new earth, for the first heaven and the first earth had passed away. Also there was no more sea.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh inh đei 'bôh plĕnh păng teh 'nao, yua kơ plĕnh păng teh adrol sơ̆ tôch boih. Mă đak dơsĭ kư̆m pă đei boih.

English: Then I, John, saw the holy city, New Jerusalem, coming down out of heaven from God, prepared as a bride adorned for her husband.
Bahnar: Na inh 'bôh Pơlei Jêrusalem 'nao mă đe anăn Pơlei 'Lơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei jur đơ̆ng plĕnh; pơlei Sư 'nao pơm 'lơ̆ng rŏ dêh dang kơ adruh 'nao đah pơhrôp hơbĕn ao 'lơ̆ng wă tơoei băl.

English: And I heard a loud voice from heaven saying, “Behold, the tabernacle of God is with men, and He will dwell with them, and they shall be His people. God Himself will be with them and be their God.
Bahnar: Păng inh kư̆m kơtơ̆ng 'bơ̆r đe pơma re đơ̆ng tang-dŏ 'Bok Kei-Dei khan thoi âu: “'Nâu boih đe khan 'Bok Kei-Dei oei hơdai hăm kon bơngai. Sư oei tŏk-bŏk hăm kon bơngai, na kon bơngai jing kon Sư păng Sư jing Kră Yang kon bơngai.

English: And God will wipe away every tear from their eyes; there shall be no more death, nor sorrow, nor crying. There shall be no more pain, for the former things have passed away.”
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei sut pơgoh đak măt lu sư, lu sư ưh pă lôch dơ̆ng, lu sư ưh pă đei tơdrong nhơ̆m hmoi ơh sơ'ngon dơ̆ng ôh, ưh pă đei tơdrong jĭ jăn păn hnong, yua kơ chăl arih so hiong tôch boih.”

English: Then He who sat on the throne said, “Behold, I make all things new.” And He said to me, “Write, for these words are true and faithful.”
Bahnar: 'Bok Kei-Dei mă oei tơ tang-dŏ khan: “Inh pơjing tôm tơdrong 'nao.” Sư wih khan dơ̆ng kơ inh thoi âu: “Ih chih răk lê̆ dôm tơdrong Inh pơma, yua kơ tơdrong âu sĭt gô đei tơpă iĕm gơh lui.”

English: And He said to me, “It is done! I am the Alpha and the Omega, the Beginning and the End. I will give of the fountain of the water of life freely to him who thirsts.
Bahnar: Na 'Bok Kei-Dei khan dơ̆ng kơ inh thoi âu: “Inh pơm tôm tơdrong keh boih. Inh thoi chư A, jĭ blŭng-a kơla chă adrol kơ đĭ-đăng lăm dôm tơdrong. Păng Inh kư̆m thoi chư Y, tuch-luch năr tôch kư̆m oei đei Inh. Thoi noh bu ol kơ đak, inh asong nhă đĕch đơ̆ng tu đak ăn kơ kon bơngai gơh arih ling-lang.

English: He who overcomes shall inherit all things, and I will be his God and he shall be My son.
Bahnar: Bu adrin tơblah păng yang kơnê̆ jei sư, sư gô đei tôm tơdrong noh, Inh jing Kră Yang sư, sư jing kon Inh.

English: But the cowardly, unbelieving, abominable, murderers, sexually immoral, sorcerers, idolaters, and all liars shall have their part in the lake which burns with fire and brimstone, which is the second death.”
Bahnar: Gah lu bơngai lêl, lu bơngai achăng tŭk tơdrong lui, lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆, lu bơngai pơlôch đe, lu bơngai pơm pơyô kư̆ kă, lu bơngai pơm pơjâu chă sol đe, lu bơngai kơkuh kơ yang nai, lu bơngai hơlĕnh pơdăr đon đe, đĭ lu bơngai thoi noh gô huŏng tơ dơnâu ŭnh tŏ hang hơt, 'noh tơdrong lôch mă 'bar.”

English: Then one of the seven angels who had the seven bowls filled with the seven last plagues came to me and talked with me, saying, “Come, I will show you the bride, the Lamb’s wife.”
Bahnar: Minh 'nu lăm tơpơh 'nu linh jang mă chĕp tơpơh tŏ pơnhan đak pơgang tơdrong pơmat đe noh, sư năm pơma kơ inh thoi âu: “Bĕ kiơ̆ inh, inh wă tơ'bôh kơ ih akăn Triu Sư 'nao oei.”

English: And he carried me away in the Spirit to a great and high mountain, and showed me the great city, the holy Jerusalem, descending out of heaven from God
Bahnar: Đang sư pơma thoi noh boih, na inh ưh kơ băt thoi yơ Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng ăn kơ linh jang pôk anhăk ba inh tơ kông tih kơjung, na sư tơ'bôh kơ inh Pơlei Jêrusalem 'nao, mă đe anăn Pơlei 'Lơ̆ng 'Bok Kei-Dei, jur đơ̆ng plĕnh.

English: having the glory of God. Her light was like a most precious stone, like a jasper stone, clear as crystal.
Bahnar: Pơlei ei 'lơ̆ng rŏ tơpă yua kơ đei 'Bok Kei-Dei oei tơ noh. Pơlei ei rang hơdah dang tơpei hu, dang tơpei maih, rang kok thoi amĭl.

English: Also she had a great and high wall with twelve gates, and twelve angels at the gates, and names written on them, which are the names of the twelve tribes of the children of Israel
Bahnar: Pơlei ei đei dur tih kơjung păng đei mơjĭt-'bar tŏ 'măng. Rim kơ 'măng đei minh 'nu linh jang 'lơ̆ng gak; tơ 'măng noh đe chih mơjĭt-'bar khŭl adrĕch adrung lu bơngai Isơrael.

English: three gates on the east, three gates on the north, three gates on the south, and three gates on the west.
Bahnar: Gah 'năr lĕch đei pêng tŏ 'măng, gah yă-nơ̆m pêng tŏ 'măng, gah gơal pêng tŏ 'măng, gah 'năr mơ̆t kư̆m đei pêng tŏ 'măng.

English: Now the wall of the city had twelve foundations, and on them were the names of the twelve apostles of the Lamb.
Bahnar: Đe trơn tơmo pơm pơlei ei, đei mơjĭt-'bar tăl tơmo. Mơjĭt-'bar tăl tơmo ei đe chih anăn mơjĭt-'bar 'nu jơ̆ng 'bang Kon Triu.

English: And he who talked with me had a gold reed to measure the city, its gates, and its wall.
Bahnar: Linh jang mă pơma hăm inh ei sư chĕp 'long thưk pơm păng maih wă pơtŏ lăng pơlei ei, 'măng pơlei ei, dur pơlei ei, tih sư dang yơ.

English: The city is laid out as a square; its length is as great as its breadth. And he measured the city with the reed: twelve thousand furlongs. Its length, breadth, and height are equal.
Bahnar: Sư pơtŏ pơlei ei păng 'long thưk wơ̆l tor sư tŏ ăi, să iĕ păng kơjung sư đei 'bar-trĭu pơđăm-hrĕng rơbâu thưk.

English: Then he measured its wall: one hundred and forty-four cubits, according to the measure of a man, that is, of an angel.
Bahnar: Dur sư pơtŏ păng ti, đơ̆ng kŭl-keng tơ hơnglâu. Kơjung sư đei minh-hrĕng puăn-jĭt puăn pơtŏ. Mă pơtŏ sư kư̆m dang ăi kơ pơtŏ kon bơngai.

English: The construction of its wall was of jasper; and the city was pure gold, like clear glass.
Bahnar: Dur sư pơm păng tơmo gôh, nơ̆r lu bơngai noh sơ̆ sư khan tơmo jasper. Pơlei sư pơm păng maih ngăl rang kok thoi amĭl.

English: The foundations of the wall of the city were adorned with all kinds of precious stones: the first foundation was jasper, the second sapphire, the third chalcedony, the fourth emerald
Bahnar: Tơmo đe trơn pơm dur pơlei ei, tơmo gĭt dêh, mă phara tơmo. Kiơ̆ kơ lu bơngai ei anăn sơ̆, tăl mônh tơmo jaspera, tăl 'bar tơmo sapphireb, tăl pêng tơmo kalsêđôc, tăl puăn tơmo sơmarađôd

English: the fifth sardonyx, the sixth sardius, the seventh chrysolite, the eighth beryl, the ninth topaz, the tenth chrysoprase, the eleventh jacinth, and the twelfth amethyst.
Bahnar: tăl pơđăm tơmo sarđôni, tăl tơdrâu tơmo sađiô, tăl tơpơh tơmo krisôlit, tăl tơhngam tơmo berelô, tăl tơsĭn tơmo tôpassiô, tăl mơjĭt tơmo krisôprais, tăl mơjĭt-mônh tơmo hiasin, tăl mơjĭt-'bar tơmo amettih.

English: The twelve gates were twelve pearls: each individual gate was of one pearl. And the street of the city was pure gold, like transparent glass.
Bahnar: Rim kơ mơjĭt-'bar tŏ 'măng dur pơlei ei đei minh găr anam tih rang kok atol pơm 'măng. Trong pơlei tă lơ̆k maih rang thoi amĭl.

English: But I saw no temple in it, for the Lord God Almighty and the Lamb are its temple.
Bahnar: Gah hnam 'Bok Kei-Dei inh ưh kơ 'bôh ôh, yua kơ Sư Kră Yang Tih Hloh, Sư hăm Kon Triu gơh oei jơ̆p-jang kơ anih, mă pơlei noh kư̆m dang hnam Sư mơ̆n.

English: The city had no need of the sun or of the moon to shine in it, for the glory of God illuminated it. The Lamb is its light.
Bahnar: Pơlei noh ưh kơ kăl kơ măt 'năr dah khei pơchrang hơdah ăn ôh, yua kơ tơdrong mơsêh 'Bok Kei-Dei hăm Kon Triu pơchrang ăn hơdah boih.

English: And the nations of those who are saved shall walk in its light, and the kings of the earth bring their glory and honor into it.
Bahnar: Rim kơ khŭl kon bơngai jơ̆p kơ teh đak gô yak nơnăm yua hơdah pơlei noh pơchrang. Kư̆m đei lu 'bok pơtao đơ̆ng jơ̆p kơ teh đak năm ư-ang kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei hăm Kon Triu tơ noh.

English: Its gates shall not be shut at all by day (there shall be no night there).
Bahnar: Pơlei noh pơchoh 'măng ling-lang ưh kơ đei tang thoi pơlei đe tơ ala teh, yua kơ ưh kơ đei măng mu tŏ sĕt, sư hơdah ling-lang.

English: And they shall bring the glory and the honor of the nations into it.
Bahnar: Jơ̆p kơ teh đak năm ư-ang kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ noh.

English: But there shall by no means enter it anything that defiles, or causes an abomination or a lie, but only those who are written in the Lamb’s Book of Life.
Bahnar: Tơdrong 'mê̆-'mach ưh kơ gơh mơ̆t ôh tơ lăm pơlei noh. Bơngai hơlĕnh, bơngai oei kơkuh kơ yang nai, ưh kơ gơh mơ̆t ôh. Pôm lu bơngai đei chih anăn lăm sơ̆p hla bơar Kon Triu đĕch gơh mơ̆t. Sơ̆p hla bơar Kon Triu noh chih anăn dôm lu bơngai mă gô arih hăm Sư ling-lang.

English: And he showed me a pure river of water of life, clear as crystal, proceeding from the throne of God and of the Lamb.
Bahnar: Đơ̆ng noh linh jang 'lơ̆ng ei tơ'bôh dơ̆ng kơ inh đak krong mă ăn kơ kon bơngai arih. Đak krong ei hlăng chơchơr thoi getchai. Sư ro đơ̆ng tang-dŏ 'Bok Kei-Dei hăm Kon Triu.

English: In the middle of its street, and on either side of the river, was the tree of life, which bore twelve fruits, each tree yielding its fruit every month. The leaves of the tree were for the healing of the nations.
Bahnar: Đak krong ei ro tŏk-bŏk pơlei hloi, cheng đak krong ei đei 'long pah âu pah to wă ăn kơ kon bơngai arih. 'Long ei minh sơnăm mơjĭt-'bar 'măng plei, rim khei minh 'măng. Hla sư kư̆m yua wă ăn kơ kon bơngai sa jing đei jơhngơ̆m pran.

English: And there shall be no more curse, but the throne of God and of the Lamb shall be in it, and His servants shall serve Him.
Bahnar: Tôm tơdrong kiơ 'Bok Kei-Dei jô̆ khan kơnê̆ ưh kơ 'bôh lăm pơlei noh. Pôm 'Bok Kei-Dei hăm Kon Triu đĕch oei hơdai hăm kon pơlei pơla lăm noh. Lu đĭch đam Sư gô kơkuh kơ Sư tơ noh.

English: They shall see His face, and His name shall be on their foreheads.
Bahnar: Lu sư gô 'bôh muh măt 'Bok Kei-Dei păng đei chơ̆m đŏng yâu 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ klĕng lu sư.

English: There shall be no night there: They need no lamp nor light of the sun, for the Lord God gives them light. And they shall reign forever and ever.
Bahnar: Măng klăm ưh pă đei boih păng lu sư ưh kơ kăl kơ măt 'năr dah ŭnh kiơ pơchrang hơdah kơ lu sư dơ̆ng ôh yua kơ akâu 'Bok Kei-Dei oei tơ noh pơchrang ăn kơ lu sư. Lu sư gô pơgơ̆r ling-lang khŏm khŏm tơ noh.

English: Then he said to me, “These words are faithful and true.” And the Lord God of the holy prophets sent His angel to show His servants the things which must shortly take place.
Bahnar: Linh jang ei khan dơ̆ng kơ inh: “Tôm tơdrong âu gô đei tơpă bơ̆n gơh lui. Sơ̆ 'Bok Kei-Dei wơh lu bơngai pơtruh nơ̆r Sư, mă dang ei kư̆m thoi noh Sư kư̆m wơh inh mă linh jang 'lơ̆ng Sư hai, năm chă pơtruh kơ lu đĭch đam Sư tơdrong wă jê̆ truh noh.”

English: “Behold, I am coming quickly! Blessed is he who keeps the words of the prophecy of this book.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan: “Inh wă jê̆ jur boih, bơngai bu lui păng kiơ̆ hloi dôm nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei roi tơbăt ăn tơ lăm sơ̆p hla bơar âu, bơngai noh sư hiôk tơpă.”

English: Now I, John, saw and heard these things. And when I heard and saw, I fell down to worship before the feet of the angel who showed me these things.
Bahnar: Anăn inh Yôhan bơngai mă kơtơ̆ng păng 'bôh dôm tơdrong noh. Inh kơtơ̆ng păng 'bôh nhên tôm thoi noh boih na inh 'nap kơkuh kơ linh jang 'bơ̆t jơ̆ng sư.

English: Then he said to me, “See that you do not do that. For I am your fellow servant, and of your brethren the prophets, and of those who keep the words of this book. Worship God.”
Bahnar: Mă-lei sư khan: “Ih 'nĕ kơkuh kơ inh, yua kơ inh kư̆m đĭch đam 'Bok Kei-Dei thoi ih, thoi lu bôl buăl ih mă pơtruh nơ̆r Sư păng thoi lu bơngai mă lui kiơ̆ kơ tơdrong chih lăm sơ̆p hla bơar âu. Ih athei kơkuh kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei đĕch trŏ.”

English: And he said to me, “Do not seal the words of the prophecy of this book, for the time is at hand.
Bahnar: Na linh jang 'lơ̆ng ei khan dơ̆ng kơ inh: “Dôm tơdrong 'Bok Kei-Dei tơbăt ăn kơ bơ̆n lăm sơ̆p hla bơar Sư âu, ih 'nĕ kơ ôn, ih athei roi tơbăt ăn kơ đe, yua kơ tơdrong âu wă jê̆ truh tơpă.

English: He who is unjust, let him be unjust still; he who is filthy, let him be filthy still; he who is righteous, let him be righteous still; he who is holy, let him be holy still.”
Bahnar: Bơngai bu arăng kơ̆l oei 'maih pơm kơnê̆, lê̆ sư pơm kơnê̆ khŏm khŏm kư̆m bưh. Bơngai bu pơm 'lơ̆ng, sư athei kơchăng pơm 'lơ̆ng ling-lang.”

English: “And behold, I am coming quickly, and My reward is with Me, to give to every one according to his work.
Bahnar: Yêsu khan thoi âu: “Inh jê̆ jur boih. Inh chĕp tơmam apah lu sư, rim 'nu kiơ̆ kơ lu sư đei pơm.

English: I am the Alpha and the Omega, the Beginning and the End, the First and the Last.”
Bahnar: Inh thoi chư A, jĭ blŭng-a kơla chă adrol kơ đĭ-đăng lăm dôm tơdrong. Păng Inh kư̆m thoi chư Y, tuch-luch năr tôch kư̆m oei đei Inh.”

English: Blessed are those who do His commandments, that they may have the right to the tree of life, and may enter through the gates into the city.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu pih ao sư rơgoh bơngai noh boih hiôk. Bơngai noh gơh sa plei 'long mă kon bơngai arih ling-lang. Păng sư noh gơh mơ̆t 'măng dur Pơlei Jêrusalem 'nao.

English: But outside are dogs and sorcerers and sexually immoral and murderers and idolaters, and whoever loves and practices a lie.
Bahnar: Lu bơngai pơm kơnê̆, lu bơngai pơm pơjâu chă sol đe, lu bơngai pơm pơyô kư̆ kă, lu bơngai pơlôch đe, lu bơngai kơkuh kơ yang nai păng dôm lu bơngai mă hơlĕnh kơ đe ưh kơ gơh mơ̆t ôh.

English: “I, Jesus, have sent My angel to testify to you these things in the churches. I am the Root and the Offspring of David, the Bright and Morning Star.”
Bahnar: Yêsu khan dơ̆ng thoi âu: “Inh Yêsu, Inh wơh linh jang 'lơ̆ng năm tơbăt ăn kơ lu iĕm mă lui kơ 'Bok Kei-Dei tơ rim anih dôm lu tơdrong âu. Inh Kon Sâu Đawit, Inh pơchrang kơ iĕm hơdah thoi sơnglŏng wŏng-tar.”

English: And the Spirit and the bride say, “Come!” And let him who hears say, “Come!” And let him who thirsts come. Whoever desires, let him take the water of life freely.
Bahnar: Yang Bơhngol 'Lơ̆ng hăm akăn Kon Triu bơtho khan kơ lu bơngai tam mă lui thoi âu: “Bu ol kơ đak nhă bĕ.” Na lu bơngai lui mă mơ̆ng đe đŏk hla bơar tơdrong âu, bĕ lu iĕm kư̆m wang chă bơtho đe thoi noh mơ̆n, khan: “Bu ol kơ đak nhă bĕ.” Năm bĕ bu ol kơ đak, nhă đak noh; đak noh gơh arih kon bơngai ling-lang, nhă đĕch ưh kơ răt ôh.

English: For I testify to everyone who hears the words of the prophecy of this book: If anyone adds to these things, God will add to him the plagues that are written in this book
Bahnar: Na 'nâu inh Yôhan wă khan lê̆ kơ đe bu mă kơtơ̆ng boih hla bơar 'Bok Kei-Dei chih tơbăt kơ bơ̆n âu: Tơ̆ng bu pơma pơthim nơ̆r sư tơ lăm hla bơar âu, bơngai noh 'Bok Kei-Dei kư̆m pơthim ăn kơ sư tơdrong pơmat kiơ̆ thoi Sư pơkă tơ lăm hla bơar âu.

English: and if anyone takes away from the words of the book of this prophecy, God shall take away his part from the Book of Life, from the holy city, and from the things which are written in this book.
Bahnar: Bơngai bu tŭk nơ̆r 'Bok Kei-Dei đơ̆ng lăm sơ̆p hla bơar Sư âu, bơngai noh Sư ưh kơ ăn sa plei 'long kon bơngai arih ôh, plei 'long mă Sư đei roi kơ bơ̆n lăm sơ̆p hla bơar âu. Sư kư̆m ưh kơ ăn sư mơ̆t tơ Pơlei Jêrusalem 'nao, pơlei mă Sư đei roi kơ bơ̆n tơ lăm sơ̆p hla bơar âu.

English: He who testifies to these things says, “Surely I am coming quickly.” Amen. Even so, come, Lord Jesus!
Bahnar: 'Bok mă pơm kơdranh kơ dôm tơdrong âu Sư khan: “Inh wă jê̆ jur tơpă.” Tơpă, ơ Kră Yang Yêsu, dah jur bĕ.

English: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all. Amen.
Bahnar: Inh apinh Kră Yang Yêsu wei-lăng đĭ-đăng kơ lu kon 'Bok Kei-Dei lăm tôm tơdrong. A-men.
